pyfock.Integrals.schwarz_helpers 

   1import numpy as np
   2from numba import njit, prange, guvectorize, float64, int16, int32, config, threading_layer, get_thread_id, get_num_threads, get_parallel_chunksize
   3from numba import cuda
   4
   5try:
   6    import cupy as cp
   7except Exception as e:
   8    pass
   9
  10from .integral_helpers import innerLoop4c2e
  11from .rys_helpers import coulomb_rys, coulomb_rys_fast, coulomb_rys_new, coulomb_rys_3c2e
  12from .integral_helpers import Fboys
  13
  14from joblib import Parallel, delayed
  15
  16def eri_4c2e_diag(basis):
  17    # Used for Schwarz inequality test
  18
  19    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
  20    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
  21    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
  22    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
  23    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
  24        
  25
  26    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
  27    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
  28    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
  29    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
  30    #it can accomadate all the lists.
  31    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
  32    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
  33    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
  34    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
  35    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
  36        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
  37            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
  38            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
  39            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
  40        
  41
  42
  43
  44    # ints4c2e_diag = eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts)
  45    ints4c2e_diag = rys_eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts)
  46
  47    return ints4c2e_diag
  48
  49# Reference: https://github.com/numba/numba/issues/8007#issuecomment-1113187684
  50parallel_options = {
  51    'comprehension': False,  # parallel comprehension
  52    'prange':        True,  # parallel for-loop
  53    'numpy':         True,  # parallel numpy calls
  54    'reduction':     False,  # parallel reduce calls
  55    'setitem':       True,  # parallel setitem
  56    'stencil':       True,  # parallel stencils
  57    'fusion':        True,  # enable fusion or not
  58}
  59@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
  60def eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts):
  61    # This function calculates the "diagonal" elements of the 4c2e ERI array
  62    # Used to implement Schwarz screening
  63    # http://vergil.chemistry.gatech.edu/notes/df.pdf
  64    # returns a 2D array whose elements are given as A[i,j] = (ij|ij) 
  65    nao = bfs_coords.shape[0]
  66    fourC2E_diag = np.zeros((nao, nao),dtype=np.float64) 
  67        
  68    pi = 3.141592653589793
  69    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
  70    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
  71
  72    #Loop pver BFs
  73    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
  74        I = bfs_coords[i]
  75        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
  76        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
  77        la, ma, na = lmni
  78        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
  79
  80        K = I
  81        lc, mc, nc = lmni
  82        
  83        for j in prange(0, i + 1): #B
  84            J = bfs_coords[j]
  85            IJ = I - J
  86            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
  87            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
  88            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
  89            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
  90            tempcoeff3 = (Ni*Nj)**2
  91            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
  92
  93
  94            ld, md, nd = lmnj
  95            
  96            
  97
  98            val = 0.0
  99            
 100            #Loop over primitives
 101            for ik in range(nprimi):   
 102                dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
 103                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
 104                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
 105                tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*(dik*Nik)**2
 106                
 107                for jk in range(nprimj):
 108                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
 109                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
 110                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
 111                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
 112                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
 113                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
 114                    PI = P - I
 115                    PJ = P - J  
 116                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
 117                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
 118                    tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*(djk*Njk)**2
 119
 120
 121                    gammaQ = gammaP
 122                    screenfactorKL = screenfactorAB
 123                    dlk = djk
 124                    Nlk = Njk     
 125                    Q = P       
 126                    PQ = P - Q
 127                    
 128                    QK = PI
 129                    QL = PJ
 130                    tempcoeff6 = tempcoeff5*dlk*Nlk
 131                    
 132                  
 133                              
 134                    fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
 135                    
 136
 137                    omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))*screenfactorKL
 138                    delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
 139                    PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
 140                        
 141                    sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
 142                        
 143                    val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff6
 144                            
 145            fourC2E_diag[i,j] = val
 146            fourC2E_diag[j,i] = val
 147        
 148    return fourC2E_diag
 149
 150@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 151def rys_eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts):
 152    # This function calculates the "diagonal" elements of the 4c2e ERI array
 153    # Used to implement Schwarz screening
 154    # http://vergil.chemistry.gatech.edu/notes/df.pdf
 155    # returns a 2D array whose elements are given as A[i,j] = (ij|ij) 
 156    nao = bfs_coords.shape[0]
 157    fourC2E_diag = np.zeros((nao, nao),dtype=np.float64) 
 158        
 159    pi = 3.141592653589793
 160    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
 161    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
 162
 163    #Loop pver BFs
 164    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
 165        I = bfs_coords[i]
 166        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
 167        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
 168        la, ma, na = lmni
 169        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
 170
 171        K = I
 172        lc, mc, nc = lmni
 173        
 174        for j in prange(0, i + 1): #B
 175            J = bfs_coords[j]
 176            IJ = I - J
 177            L = J
 178            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
 179            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
 180            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
 181            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
 182            tempcoeff3 = (Ni*Nj)**2
 183            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
 184
 185
 186            ld, md, nd = lmnj
 187            
 188            
 189            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
 190            roots = np.zeros((10))
 191            weights = np.zeros((10))
 192            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
 193            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
 194            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
 195            val = 0.0
 196            
 197            #Loop over primitives
 198            for ik in range(nprimi):   
 199                dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
 200                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
 201                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
 202                tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*(dik*Nik)**2
 203                
 204                for jk in range(nprimj):
 205                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
 206                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
 207                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
 208                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
 209                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
 210                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
 211                    PI = P - I
 212                    PJ = P - J  
 213                    
 214                      
 215                    tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*(djk*Njk)**2
 216
 217
 218                    gammaQ = gammaP
 219                    screenfactorKL = screenfactorAB
 220                    dlk = djk
 221                    Nlk = Njk     
 222                    Q = P       
 223                    PQ = P - Q
 224                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
 225                    
 226                    QK = PI
 227                    QL = PJ
 228                    tempcoeff6 = tempcoeff5*dlk*Nlk
 229                    
 230                  
 231                              
 232                    
 233
 234                    # (ss|ss) case
 235                    if (la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)==0: 
 236                        val += tempcoeff6*twopisq/(gammaP*gammaQ)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP+gammaQ))\
 237                            *screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL*Fboys(0,PQsq/(1/gammaP+1/gammaQ))
 238                    elif norder<=10:
 239                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
 240                        val += tempcoeff6*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphaik, alphajk,I,J,K,L)
 241                    else:                                
 242                        onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP
 243                        fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
 244                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
 245                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))*screenfactorKL
 246                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
 247                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
 248                            
 249                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
 250                            
 251                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff6
 252                            
 253            fourC2E_diag[i,j] = val
 254            fourC2E_diag[j,i] = val
 255        
 256    return fourC2E_diag
 257
 258@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 259def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold):
 260    # This function will return a numpy array of the same size as ints3c2e array (nao*nao*naux)
 261    # The array will have a value of 1 where there is a significant contribution and 0 otherwise.
 262    # Later on this array can be used to find the indices of non-zero arrays
 263    indices = np.zeros((nao, nao, naux), dtype=np.uint8)
 264    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 265    for i in range(nao):
 266        for j in range(i+1):
 267            for k in prange(naux):
 268                if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[i,j])*np.sqrt(ints2c2e[k,k])>threshold:
 269                    indices[i,j,k] = 1
 270    return indices
 271
 272@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 273def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz):
 274    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
 275    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
 276    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
 277    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
 278    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 279    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 280    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 281    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 282    count = 0
 283    for i in prange(istart, nao):
 284        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
 285            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
 286            if j==i:
 287                jstart = 0
 288            if strict_schwarz:
 289                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
 290                    continue
 291            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
 292                if k==naux-1:
 293                    # jstart = 0
 294                    kstart = 0
 295                if count<chunk_size:
 296                    if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 297                        indicesA[count] = i
 298                        indicesB[count] = j
 299                        indicesC[count] = k
 300                        count += 1
 301                else:
 302                    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 303                
 304    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 305
 306@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 307def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_fine(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
 308    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
 309    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
 310    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
 311    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
 312    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 313    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 314    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 315    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 316    count = 0
 317    for i in prange(istart, nao):
 318        # coord_i = bfs_coords[i]
 319        # cutoff_i = bfs_radius_cutoff[i]
 320        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
 321            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
 322            if j==i:
 323                jstart = 0
 324            # coord_j = bfs_coords[j]
 325            if strict_schwarz:
 326                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
 327                    continue    
 328            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
 329                if k==naux-1:
 330                    # jstart = 0
 331                    kstart = 0
 332                # coord_k = auxbfs_coords[k]
 333                # print(coord_k - coord_i) # Gives segmentation fault
 334                # print(coord_k)
 335                # print(coord_i)
 336                # print(np.linalg.norm(coord_k-coord_i))
 337                # if np.sqrt(np.sum((coord_k - coord_i)**2))>18:# and abs(np.linalg.norm(coord_k-coord_j))<bfs_radius_cutoff[j]:
 338                #     continue
 339                if count<chunk_size:
 340                    if strict_schwarz:
 341                        max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
 342                        if max_val>threshold:
 343                            if max_val<1e-8:
 344                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<1: # s aux functions
 345                                    indicesA[count] = i
 346                                    indicesB[count] = j
 347                                    indicesC[count] = k
 348                                    count += 1
 349                            elif max_val<1e-7:
 350                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<2: # s, p aux functions
 351                                    indicesA[count] = i
 352                                    indicesB[count] = j
 353                                    indicesC[count] = k
 354                                    count += 1
 355                            elif max_val<1e-6:
 356                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<3: # s, p, d aux functions
 357                                    indicesA[count] = i
 358                                    indicesB[count] = j
 359                                    indicesC[count] = k
 360                                    count += 1
 361                            else:
 362                                indicesA[count] = i
 363                                indicesB[count] = j
 364                                indicesC[count] = k
 365                                count += 1
 366                    else:
 367                        if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 368                            indicesA[count] = i
 369                            indicesB[count] = j
 370                            indicesC[count] = k
 371                            count += 1
 372                else:
 373                    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 374    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 375
 376@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 377def calc_offsets_3c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm, ntri, naux, tril_indicesA, tril_indicesB):
 378    # Calculate the offsets for 3c2e integral evluations
 379    offsets = np.zeros((ntri+1), dtype=np.uint16)
 380    offsets[0] = 0
 381    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 382    for ij in prange(ntri):
 383        i = tril_indicesA[ij]
 384        j = tril_indicesB[ij]
 385        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j] 
 386        if strict_schwarz:
 387            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
 388                continue    
 389        count = 0
 390        for k in range(naux):    
 391            # if strict_schwarz:
 392            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
 393            #     if max_val>threshold:
 394            #         if max_val<1e-8:
 395            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<1: # s aux functions
 396            #                 count += 1
 397            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
 398            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<2: # s, p aux functions
 399            #                 count += 1
 400            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
 401            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<3: # s, p, d aux functions
 402            #                 count += 1
 403            #         else:
 404            #             count += 1
 405            # else:  
 406            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 407            #         count += 1
 408            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 409                count += 1
 410        offsets[ij+1] = count 
 411    return offsets
 412
 413@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 414def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz3(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold):
 415    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
 416    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
 417    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
 418    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
 419    offset = np.zeros((nao), dtype=np.uint32)
 420    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 421    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 422    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 423    count = 0
 424    indx_offset = 0
 425    for i in prange(istart, nao):
 426        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
 427            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
 428            if j==i:
 429                jstart = 0
 430            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
 431                if k==naux-1:
 432                    # jstart = 0
 433                    kstart = 0
 434                if count<chunk_size:
 435                    if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 436                        indicesB[count] = j
 437                        indicesC[count] = k
 438                        count += 1
 439                        offset[i] = count
 440                else:
 441                    return offset, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 442    return offset, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 443
 444@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 445def calc_count_3c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold):
 446    # Calculates the total no. of significant 3c2e triplets after Schwarz screening
 447    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 448    count = 0
 449    for i in prange(0, nao):
 450        for j in prange(0, i+1):
 451            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
 452            for k in prange(0, naux):
 453                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
 454                    count += 1
 455    return count
 456
 457@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 458def calc_indices_4c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, chunk_size, nao, istart, jstart, kstart, lstart, threshold):
 459    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
 460    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
 461    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
 462    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
 463    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 464    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 465    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 466    indicesD = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 467    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 468    count = 0
 469    for i in prange(istart, nao):
 470        for j in range(jstart, i+1):
 471            if i<j:
 472                triangle2ij = (j)*(j+1)/2+i
 473            else:
 474                triangle2ij = (i)*(i+1)/2+j
 475            if j==i:
 476                jstart = 0
 477            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
 478            for k in range(kstart, nao):
 479                if k==nao:
 480                    kstart = 0
 481                for l in range(lstart, k+1):
 482                    if k<l:
 483                        triangle2kl = (l)*(l+1)/2+k
 484                    else:
 485                        triangle2kl = (k)*(k+1)/2+l
 486                    if triangle2ij>triangle2kl:
 487                        continue
 488                    if l==k:
 489                        lstart = 0
 490                    sqrt_kl = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[k,l]
 491                    if count<chunk_size:
 492                        if sqrt_ij*sqrt_kl>threshold:
 493                            indicesA[count] = i
 494                            indicesB[count] = j
 495                            indicesC[count] = k
 496                            indicesD[count] = l
 497                            count += 1
 498                    else:
 499                        return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, [i,j,k,l], count
 500    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, [i,j,k], count
 501
 502@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 503def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2_test(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold):
 504    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
 505    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
 506    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
 507    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
 508    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 509    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 510    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 511    # Loop over k first
 512    count = 0
 513    for k in prange(kstart, naux):
 514        for i in range(istart, nao):
 515            jstart = i if i == istart else 0
 516            for j in range(jstart, i+1):
 517                if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[i, j]) * np.sqrt(ints2c2e[k, k]) > threshold:
 518                    if count < chunk_size:
 519                        indicesA[count] = i
 520                        indicesB[count] = j
 521                        indicesC[count] = k
 522                        count += 1
 523                    else:
 524                        return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 525            kstart = 0 # reset kstart for the next j loop
 526    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
 527
 528@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 529def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_shells(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, threshold):
 530    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2'. 
 531    # Instead of calculating the indices which yield non zero contributions, 
 532    # it calculates the shell indices.
 533    # This will probably take the same amount of time as 
 534    # 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2' but will require much less memory, as instead of having three indices for 
 535    # px,py and pz we will just have an index corresponding to p.
 536    indicesA_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 537    indicesB_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 538    indicesC_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
 539    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
 540    count = 0
 541    ishell_previous = 0
 542    jshell_previous = 0
 543    kshell_previous = 0
 544    for ibf in range(istart, nao):
 545        ishell = shell_indices[ibf]
 546        for jbf in range(jstart, ibf+1):
 547            jshell = shell_indices[jbf]
 548            if jbf==ibf:
 549                jstart = 0
 550            for kbf in prange(kstart, naux):
 551                kshell = aux_shell_indices[kbf]
 552                if count>0 and (ishell==ishell_previous and jshell==jshell_previous and kshell==kshell_previous):
 553                    # print(ishell, ishell_previous)
 554                    continue
 555                if kbf==naux-1:
 556                    # jstart = 0
 557                    kstart = 0
 558                if count<chunk_size:
 559                    if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[ibf, jbf])*np.sqrt(ints2c2e[kbf, kbf])>threshold:
 560                        indicesA_shells[count] = ishell
 561                        indicesB_shells[count] = jshell
 562                        indicesC_shells[count] = kshell
 563                        count += 1
 564                else:
 565                    return indicesA_shells, indicesB_shells, indicesC_shells, [ibf,jbf,kbf], count
 566                ishell_previous = ishell
 567                jshell_previous = jshell
 568                kshell_previous = kshell
 569    return indicesA_shells, indicesB_shells, indicesC_shells, [ibf,jbf,kbf], count
 570
 571def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC):
 572    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 573    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 574    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 575
 576    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 577    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 578    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 579    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 580    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 581
 582    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 583    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 584    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 585    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 586    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 587        
 588
 589    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 590    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 591    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 592    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 593    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 594    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 595    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 596    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 597    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 598    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 599        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 600            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 601            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 602            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 603
 604    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 605    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 606    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 607    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 608    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 609        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 610            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 611            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 612            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 613    
 614
 615    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 616                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 617                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao)
 618    return ints3c2e
 619
 620def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC):
 621    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 622    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 623    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 624
 625    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
 626
 627    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 628    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 629    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 630    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 631    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 632
 633    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 634    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 635    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 636    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 637    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 638        
 639
 640    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 641    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 642    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 643    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 644    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 645    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 646    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 647    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 648    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 649    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 650    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 651    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 652        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 653            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 654            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 655            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 656
 657    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 658    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 659    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 660    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 661    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 662        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 663            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 664            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 665            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 666
 667    
 668
 669    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
 670    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
 671    # IJsq_arr = 0
 672    # print(IJsq_arr.nbytes/1e9)
 673
 674    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
 675    # exit()
 676    
 677
 678    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 679                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 680                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices)
 681    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
 682    return ints3c2e
 683
 684def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant):
 685    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 686    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 687    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 688
 689    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
 690
 691    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 692    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 693    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 694    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 695    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 696
 697    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 698    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 699    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 700    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 701    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 702        
 703
 704    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 705    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 706    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 707    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 708    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 709    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 710    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 711    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 712    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 713    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 714    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 715    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 716        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 717            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 718            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 719            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 720
 721    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 722    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 723    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 724    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 725    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 726        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 727            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 728            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 729            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 730
 731    
 732
 733    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
 734    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
 735    # IJsq_arr = 0
 736    # print(IJsq_arr.nbytes/1e9)
 737
 738    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
 739    # exit()
 740    
 741
 742    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 743                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 744                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant)
 745    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
 746    return ints3c2e
 747
 748def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse2(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, ncores):
 749    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 750    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 751    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 752
 753    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
 754
 755    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 756    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 757    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 758    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 759    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 760
 761    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 762    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 763    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 764    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 765    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 766        
 767
 768    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 769    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 770    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 771    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 772    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 773    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 774    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 775    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 776    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 777    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 778        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 779            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 780            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 781            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 782
 783    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 784    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 785    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 786    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 787    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 788        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 789            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 790            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 791            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 792
 793    
 794
 795    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
 796    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
 797    # IJsq_arr = 0
 798
 799    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
 800    # exit()
 801    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
 802    ints3c2e = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
 803
 804    # This works but not the best way to calculate
 805    # chunk_size = min(ntriplets, 100000)
 806    # nchunks = ntriplets // chunk_size #+ 1
 807
 808    if ntriplets>100000: # No parallelization upto 100000 values
 809        nchunks = ncores*2
 810        chunk_size = ntriplets//nchunks
 811
 812
 813    print(nchunks)
 814    print(chunk_size)
 815
 816    # ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 817    #             bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 818    #             aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, chunk_size, threeC2E)
 819    # output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem')(delayed(rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2)(iblock, blocksize, weights[iblock*blocksize : min(iblock*blocksize+blocksize,ngrids)], coords[iblock*blocksize : min(iblock*blocksize+blocksize,ngrids)], ngrids, basis, dmat[np.ix_(list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]], list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]])], funcid, bfs_data_as_np_arrays, list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]], list_ao_values[iblock], funcx=funcx, funcc=funcc, x_family_code=x_family_code, c_family_code=c_family_code, xc_family_dict=xc_family_dict) for ichunk in range(nchunks))
 820    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem')(delayed(rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2)(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 821                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 822                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], indicesB[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], indicesC[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, chunk_size, ints3c2e[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)]) for ichunk in range(nchunks+1))
 823    # print(ints3c2e)
 824    return ints3c2e
 825
 826def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8(basis, auxbasis, ntriplets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold):
 827    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 828    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 829    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 830
 831    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
 832
 833    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 834    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 835    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 836    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 837    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 838
 839    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 840    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 841    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 842    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 843    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 844        
 845
 846    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 847    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 848    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 849    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 850    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 851    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 852    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 853    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 854    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 855    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 856    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 857    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 858        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 859            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 860            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 861            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 862
 863    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 864    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 865    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 866    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 867    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 868        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 869            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 870            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 871            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 872    
 873
 874    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 875                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 876                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, ntriplets, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold)
 877    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
 878    return ints3c2e
 879
 880def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9(basis, auxbasis, offset, indicesB, indicesC):
 881    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
 882    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
 883    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
 884
 885    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
 886
 887    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 888    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
 889    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 890    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
 891    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
 892
 893    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
 894    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
 895    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
 896    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
 897    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
 898        
 899
 900    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
 901    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
 902    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
 903    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
 904    #it can accomadate all the lists.
 905    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
 906    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 907    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 908    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
 909    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 910    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
 911    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
 912        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 913            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 914            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 915            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 916
 917    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
 918    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 919    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 920    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
 921    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
 922        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
 923            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
 924            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
 925            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
 926
 927    
 928
 929    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
 930    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
 931    
 932
 933    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
 934                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
 935                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, offset, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices)
 936    return ints3c2e
 937
 938
 939@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 940def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux):
 941    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
 942    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
 943
 944    threeC2E = np.zeros((int(nao*(nao+1)/2.0),naux), dtype=np.float64) 
 945
 946    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
 947   
 948        
 949    pi = 3.141592653589793
 950    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
 951    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
 952    L = np.zeros((3))
 953    alphalk = 0.0
 954    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
 955
 956    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
 957    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
 958    
 959    #Loop over BFs
 960    for itemp in prange(ntriplets): 
 961        i = indicesA[itemp]
 962        j = indicesB[itemp]
 963        k = indicesC[itemp]
 964        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
 965        I = bfs_coords[i]
 966        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
 967        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
 968        la, ma, na = lmni
 969
 970        J = bfs_coords[j]
 971        IJ = I - J
 972        IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
 973        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
 974        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
 975        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
 976        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
 977        
 978        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
 979        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
 980        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
 981        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
 982        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
 983                
 984               
 985                  
 986        KL = K - L
 987        KLsq = np.sum(KL**2)
 988                
 989                # npriml = bfs_nprim[l]
 990
 991        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
 992        val = 0.0
 993        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
 994            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
 995            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
 996            roots = np.zeros((norder))
 997            weights = np.zeros((norder))
 998            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
 999                
1000
1001            
1002                
1003            #Loop over primitives
1004            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1005                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1006                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1007                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1008                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1009                    
1010                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1011                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1012                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1013                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1014                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1015                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1016                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1017                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1018                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1019                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1020                        # used there as well
1021                        continue
1022                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1023                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1024                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1025                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1026                        
1027                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1028                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1029                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1030                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1031                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1032                              
1033                            
1034                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1035                        screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1036                        if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1037                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1038                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1039                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1040                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1041                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1042                            # used there as well
1043                            continue
1044                        # if abs(screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL)<1.0e-10:   
1045                        #     #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
1046                        #     continue
1047                          
1048                        Q = K      
1049                        PQ = P - Q
1050                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1051                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
1052                                
1053                                
1054                                
1055                                  
1056                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1057                            
1058        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1059            #Loop over primitives
1060            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1061                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1062                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1063                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1064                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1065                    
1066                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1067                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1068                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1069                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1070                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1071                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1072                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1073                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1074                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1075                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1076                        # used there as well
1077                        continue
1078                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
1079                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
1080                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1081                    PI = P - I
1082                    PJ = P - J  
1083                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
1084                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
1085                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1086                        
1087                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1088                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1089                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1090                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1091                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1092                              
1093                        
1094                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1095                        screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1096                        if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1097                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1098                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1099                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1100                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1101                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1102                            # used there as well
1103                            continue
1104                        
1105                        Q = K     
1106                        PQ = P - Q
1107                                
1108                        QK = Q - K
1109                        QL = Q #- L
1110                        
1111                                  
1112                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1113                                
1114
1115                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))
1116                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1117                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1118                                    
1119                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1120                                    
1121                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1122
1123        threeC2E[j+offset,k] = val
1124                                    
1125                                   
1126                            
1127        
1128    return threeC2E
1129
1130@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
1131def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
1132    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1133    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1134    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1135    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1136    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1137
1138    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1139    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
1140
1141    #Debug:
1142    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1143    # print(threading_layer())
1144    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1145    # print(ntriplets)
1146    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1147    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1148        
1149    pi = 3.141592653589793
1150    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1151    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1152    L = np.zeros((3))
1153    alphalk = 0.0
1154    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1155
1156    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1157    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1158    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1159    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1160
1161    
1162    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1163    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1164
1165    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1166    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1167    
1168
1169    #Loop over BFs
1170    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
1171        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1172
1173        
1174
1175        i = indicesA[itemp]
1176        j = indicesB[itemp]
1177        k = indicesC[itemp]
1178        
1179        
1180
1181        # ishell = shell_indices[i]
1182        
1183        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1184        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1185        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1186        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1187        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1188        la, ma, na = lmni
1189        I = bfs_coords[i]
1190
1191        # jshell = shell_indices[j]
1192        
1193        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1194        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1195        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1196        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1197        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1198        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1199        J = bfs_coords[j]
1200
1201        
1202        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1203        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1204        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1205        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1206        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1207        
1208        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1209        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1210        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1211        alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1212        alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1213        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1214        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1215        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1216        Q = K   
1217
1218        
1219        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1220        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1221        tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1222        tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1223        # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1224        # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1225            
1226            
1227            
1228        val = 0.0
1229        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1230            
1231            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1232            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1233            # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1234            # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1235            roots = np.zeros((10)) 
1236            weights = np.zeros((10)) 
1237            # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1238            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1239            
1240                
1241            #Loop over primitives
1242            for ik in range(nprimi): 
1243                alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
1244                tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
1245                for jk in range(nprimj):
1246                    alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
1247                    # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1248                    gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1249                    gamma_inv = 1/gammaP_
1250                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1251                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1252                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
1253                        
1254                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1255                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1256                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1257                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1258                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1259                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1260                        # used there as well
1261                        continue
1262
1263                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1264                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1265                    P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
1266                    PQ = P - Q
1267                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1268                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
1269
1270                    # screenfactor_2 = tempcoeff4/Nk*screenfactorAB*gamma_inv*np.sqrt(gamma_inv)*15.5031383401
1271                    # if abs(screenfactor_2)<1.0e-9: # The threshold used here should be the same as Schwarz screening threshold
1272                    #     continue 
1273                    
1274                    # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
1275                        
1276                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1277
1278                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1279                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1280                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1281                              
1282                            
1283                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1284                        rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
1285                                
1286                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1287                        # X = PQsq*rho
1288                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1289                        # print('s')
1290                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L,P)
1291                        # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
1292                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1293                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
1294                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1295                            
1296        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1297            #Loop over primitives
1298            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1299                for jk in range(nprimj):
1300                    
1301                    gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1302                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1303                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1304                    screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1305                        
1306                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1307                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1308                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1309                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1310                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1311                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1312                        # used there as well
1313                        continue
1314                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1315                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1316                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1317                    PI = P - I
1318                    PJ = P - J  
1319                    PQ = P - Q
1320                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
1321                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
1322                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1323                        
1324                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1325                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1326                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1327                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1328                              
1329                        
1330                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
1331                        
1332                        
1333                                
1334                        QK = Q - K
1335                        QL = Q #- L
1336                        
1337                                  
1338                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1339                                
1340
1341                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
1342                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1343                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1344                                    
1345                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1346                                    
1347                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1348
1349        threeC2E[itemp] = val
1350                                    
1351                                 
1352
1353    return threeC2E
1354
1355@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
1356def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant):
1357    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1358    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1359    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1360    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1361    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1362
1363    threeC2E = np.zeros((nsignificant), dtype=np.float64) 
1364
1365    #Debug:
1366    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1367    # print(threading_layer())
1368    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1369    # print(ntriplets)
1370    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1371    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1372        
1373    pi = 3.141592653589793
1374    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1375    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1376    L = np.zeros((3))
1377    alphalk = 0.0
1378    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1379
1380    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1381    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1382    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1383    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1384
1385    
1386    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1387    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1388
1389    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1390    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1391    
1392
1393    #Loop over BFs
1394    for itemp in prange(indicesA.shape[0]):
1395        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1396
1397        
1398
1399        i = indicesA[itemp]
1400        j = indicesB[itemp]
1401        
1402        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j] 
1403
1404        if strict_schwarz:
1405            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
1406                continue  
1407
1408        # ishell = shell_indices[i]
1409        
1410        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1411        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1412        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1413        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1414        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1415        la, ma, na = lmni
1416        I = bfs_coords[i]
1417
1418        # jshell = shell_indices[j]
1419        
1420        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1421        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1422        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1423        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1424        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1425        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1426        J = bfs_coords[j]
1427
1428        
1429        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1430        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1431        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1432        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1433        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1434        
1435        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1436        index_k = 0
1437        for k in range(naux):
1438            lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1439            lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1440            # if strict_schwarz:
1441            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
1442            #     if max_val>threshold:
1443            #         if max_val<1e-8:
1444            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=1: # s aux functions
1445            #                 continue
1446            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
1447            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=2: # s, p aux functions
1448            #                 continue
1449            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
1450            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
1451            #                 continue
1452            #     else:
1453            #         continue
1454                    
1455            # else:  
1456            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<threshold:
1457            #         continue
1458            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<threshold:
1459                continue
1460            Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1461            nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1462            alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1463            alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1464            
1465            
1466            K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1467            Q = K   
1468
1469            
1470            tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1471            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1472            tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1473            tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1474            # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1475            # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1476                
1477                
1478                
1479            val = 0.0
1480            if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1481                
1482                n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1483                m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1484                # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1485                # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1486                roots = np.zeros((10)) 
1487                weights = np.zeros((10)) 
1488                # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1489                G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1490                
1491                    
1492                #Loop over primitives
1493                for ik in range(nprimi): 
1494                    alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
1495                    tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
1496                    for jk in range(nprimj):
1497                        alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
1498                        # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1499                        gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1500                        gamma_inv = 1/gammaP_
1501                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1502                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1503                        screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
1504                            
1505                        if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1506                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1507                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1508                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1509                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1510                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1511                            # used there as well
1512                            continue
1513
1514                        djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1515                        Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1516                        P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
1517                        PQ = P - Q
1518                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1519                        tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
1520
1521                        # screenfactor_2 = tempcoeff4/Nk*screenfactorAB*gamma_inv*np.sqrt(gamma_inv)*15.5031383401
1522                        # if abs(screenfactor_2)<1.0e-9: # The threshold used here should be the same as Schwarz screening threshold
1523                        #     continue 
1524                        
1525                        # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
1526                            
1527                        for kk in range(nprimk):
1528
1529                            dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1530                            Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1531                            tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1532                                
1533                                
1534                            gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1535                            rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
1536                                    
1537                            # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1538                            # X = PQsq*rho
1539                            # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1540                            # print('s')
1541                            val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L,P)
1542                            # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
1543                            # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1544                            # The following should have been faster but isnt
1545                            # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1546                            
1547            
1548            threeC2E[offsets[itemp]+index_k] = val
1549            index_k += 1
1550                                 
1551
1552    return threeC2E
1553
1554
1555
1556
1557@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
