1558def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal_old(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
1559    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1560    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1561    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1562    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1563    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1564
1565    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1566    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
1567
1568    #Debug:
1569    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1570    # print(threading_layer())
1571    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1572    # print(ntriplets)
1573    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1574    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1575        
1576    pi = 3.141592653589793
1577    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1578    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1579    L = np.zeros((3))
1580    alphalk = 0.0
1581    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1582
1583    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1584    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1585    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1586    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1587
1588    
1589    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1590    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1591
1592    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1593    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1594
1595    # ncores = get_num_threads()
1596    # ishell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1597    # jshell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1598    # kshell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1599    # # The values don't have any significance. I just hope that the first triplet doesn't coincidentally have these values
1600    # ishell_previous[:] = 999
1601    # jshell_previous[:] = 918
1602    # kshell_previous[:] = 202
1603    
1604    ishell_previous = -1
1605    jshell_previous = -1
1606    kshell_previous = -1
1607
1608    #Loop over BFs
1609    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
1610        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1611
1612        
1613
1614        i = indicesA[itemp]
1615        j = indicesB[itemp]
1616        k = indicesC[itemp]
1617
1618        
1619        # i_previous = indicesA[itemp-1]
1620        # j_previous = indicesB[itemp-1]
1621        # k_previous = indicesC[itemp-1]
1622
1623        # ishell_previous = shell_indices[i_previous]
1624        # jshell_previous = shell_indices[j_previous]
1625        # kshell_previous = shell_indices[k_previous]
1626        # if itemp!=0:
1627        #     i_previous = indicesA[itemp-1]
1628        #     j_previous = indicesB[itemp-1]
1629        #     k_previous = indicesC[itemp-1]
1630
1631        #     ishell_previous = shell_indices[i_previous]
1632        #     jshell_previous = shell_indices[j_previous]
1633        #     kshell_previous = shell_indices[k_previous]
1634        # else:
1635        #     ishell_previous = -1
1636        #     jshell_previous = -1
1637        #     kshell_previous = -1
1638        
1639        
1640
1641        ishell = shell_indices[i]
1642        if ishell!=ishell_previous:
1643            Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1644            nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1645            alphaik = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1646            alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1647        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1648        la, ma, na = lmni
1649        I = bfs_coords[i]
1650
1651        jshell = shell_indices[j]
1652        if jshell!=jshell_previous:
1653            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1654            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1655            alphajk = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1656            alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1657        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1658        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1659        J = bfs_coords[j]
1660
1661        if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1662            IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1663            tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1664            gammaP = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1665            screenfactorAB = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1666            # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1667        
1668        kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1669        if kshell!=kshell_previous:
1670            Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1671            nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1672            alphakk = np.zeros(aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1673            alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1674        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1675        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1676        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1677        Q = K   
1678                
1679        if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous or kshell!=kshell_previous:
1680            tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1681            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1682            tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1683            tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1684            # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1685            # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1686            
1687            
1688            
1689        val = 0.0
1690        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1691            if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous or kshell!=kshell_previous:
1692                n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1693                m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1694                roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1695                weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1696                # roots = np.zeros((5)) 
1697                # weights = np.zeros((5)) 
1698                G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1699            
1700                
1701            #Loop over primitives
1702            for ik in range(nprimi): 
1703                for jk in range(nprimj):
1704                    if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1705                        gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1706                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1707                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1708                        screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1709                        
1710                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1711                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1712                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1713                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1714                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1715                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1716                        # used there as well
1717                        continue
1718                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1719                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1720                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1721                    PQ = P - Q
1722                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1723                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1724                    
1725                        
1726                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1727                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1728                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1729                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1730                              
1731                            
1732                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1733                        rho = gammaP[ik,jk]*gammaQ/(gammaP[ik,jk]+gammaQ)
1734                                
1735                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1736                        # X = PQsq*rho
1737                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1738                                
1739                                  
1740                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk],alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1741                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
1742                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1743                            
1744        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1745            #Loop over primitives
1746            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1747                for jk in range(nprimj):
1748                    if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1749                        gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1750                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1751                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1752                        screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1753                        
1754                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1755                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1756                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1757                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1758                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1759                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1760                        # used there as well
1761                        continue
1762                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1763                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1764                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1765                    PI = P - I
1766                    PJ = P - J  
1767                    PQ = P - Q
1768                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
1769                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
1770                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1771                        
1772                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1773                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1774                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1775                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1776                              
1777                        
1778                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
1779                        
1780                        
1781                                
1782                        QK = Q - K
1783                        QL = Q #- L
1784                        
1785                                  
1786                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1787                                
1788
1789                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
1790                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1791                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1792                                    
1793                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1794                                    
1795                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1796
1797        threeC2E[itemp] = val
1798        # ishell_previous = ishell
1799        # jshell_previous = jshell
1800        # kshell_previous = kshell 
1801                                    
1802                                 
1803
1804    return threeC2E
1805
1806@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy",nogil=True)
1807def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, ntriplets, threeC2E):
1808    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1809    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1810    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1811    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1812    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1813
1814    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1815    
1816
1817    #Debug:
1818    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1819    # print(threading_layer())
1820    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1821    # print(ntriplets)
1822    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1823    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1824        
1825    pi = 3.141592653589793
1826    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1827    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1828    L = np.zeros((3))
1829    alphalk = 0.0
1830    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1831
1832    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1833    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1834    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1835    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1836
1837    
1838
1839    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1840    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1841
1842     
1843    
1844    #Loop over BFs
1845    for itemp in range(0,ntriplets): 
1846        i = indicesA[itemp]
1847        j = indicesB[itemp]
1848        k = indicesC[itemp]
1849        I = bfs_coords[i]
1850        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1851        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1852        la, ma, na = lmni
1853        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1854
1855        J = bfs_coords[j]
1856        # IJ = I - J
1857        # IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
1858        # IJsq = np.dot(IJ,IJ)
1859        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1860        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1861        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1862        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1863        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1864        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1865        
1866        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1867        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1868        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1869        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1870        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1871        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1872                
1873               
1874                  
1875        # KL = K - L
1876        # KLsq = np.sum(K**2)
1877        # KLsq = np.dot(K,K)
1878                
1879                # npriml = bfs_nprim[l]
1880
1881        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1882        val = 0.0
1883        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1884            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1885            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1886            roots = np.zeros((norder))
1887            weights = np.zeros((norder))
1888            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
1889            # G[:,:] = 0.0
1890            # roots[:] = 0.0
1891            # weights[:] = 0.0 
1892
1893            
1894                
1895            #Loop over primitives
1896            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1897                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1898                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1899                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1900                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1901                    
1902                for jk in range(nprimj):
1903                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1904                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1905                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1906                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1907                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1908                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1909                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1910                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1911                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1912                        # used there as well
1913                        continue
1914                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1915                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1916                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1917                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1918                        
1919                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1920                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1921                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1922                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1923                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1924                              
1925                            
1926                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1927                        # screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1928                        # if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1929                        #     #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1930                        #     # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1931                        #     # actually worsened the agreement.
1932                        #     # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1933                        #     # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1934                        #     # used there as well
1935                        #     continue
1936                        # # if abs(screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL)<1.0e-10:   
1937                        # #     #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
1938                        # #     continue
1939                          
1940                        Q = K      
1941                        PQ = P - Q
1942                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1943                        # PQsq = np.dot(PQ,PQ)
1944                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
1945                                
1946                                
1947                                
1948                                  
1949                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1950                            
1951        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1952            #Loop over primitives
1953            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1954                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1955                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1956                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1957                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1958                    
1959                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1960                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1961                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1962                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1963                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1964                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1965                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1966                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1967                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1968                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1969                        # used there as well
1970                        continue
1971                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
1972                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
1973                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1974                    PI = P - I
1975                    PJ = P - J  
1976                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
1977                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
1978                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1979                        
1980                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1981                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1982                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1983                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1984                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1985                              
1986                        
1987                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1988                        # screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1989                        # if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1990                        #     #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1991                        #     # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1992                        #     # actually worsened the agreement.
1993                        #     # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1994                        #     # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1995                        #     # used there as well
1996                        #     continue
1997                        
1998                        Q = K     
1999                        PQ = P - Q
2000                                
2001                        QK = Q - K
2002                        QL = Q #- L
2003                        
2004                                  
2005                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2006                                
2007
2008                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))
2009                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2010                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2011                                    
2012                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2013                                    
2014                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2015
2016        threeC2E[itemp] = val
2017                                    
2018                                   
2019                            
2020    #Debug:
2021    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2022    # print(threading_layer())
2023
2024    return None
2025
2026@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy",nogil=True)
2027def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, offset, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
2028    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
2029    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
2030    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
2031    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
2032    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
2033
2034    ntriplets = indicesB.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
2035    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
2036
2037    #Debug:
2038    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2039    # print(threading_layer())
2040    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2041    # print(ntriplets)
2042    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
2043    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2044        
2045    pi = 3.141592653589793
2046    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
2047    L = np.zeros((3))
2048    alphalk = 0.0
2049    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
2050
2051    
2052    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
2053    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
2054
2055    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
2056    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
2057
2058    ibatch_threads = np.zeros(get_num_threads(), dtype=np.uint8)
2059    i_threads = np.zeros(get_num_threads(), dtype=np.uint8)
2060
2061    #Loop over BFs
2062    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
2063        id_thrd = get_thread_id()
2064
2065        if ibatch_threads[id_thrd]<offset.shape[0]:
2066            if itemp>=offset[ibatch_threads[id_thrd]]:
2067                ibatch_threads[id_thrd] +=1
2068                i_threads[id_thrd] += 1 
2069                
2070                # print(itemp)
2071                # print(ibatch_threads)
2072                # print(i_threads)
2073        
2074
2075        i = i_threads[id_thrd]
2076        j = indicesB[itemp]
2077        k = indicesC[itemp]
2078        
2079        
2080        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
2081        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
2082        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2083        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
2084        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
2085        la, ma, na = lmni
2086        I = bfs_coords[i]
2087
2088        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
2089        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
2090        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2091        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
2092        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
2093        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
2094        J = bfs_coords[j]
2095
2096        
2097        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
2098        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
2099        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2100        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2101        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2102        
2103        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
2104        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
2105        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
2106        alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2107        alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
2108        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
2109        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
2110        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
2111        Q = K   
2112
2113        
2114        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
2115        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
2116        tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
2117        tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
2118        # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
2119        # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
2120            
2121            
2122            
2123        val = 0.0
2124        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
2125            
2126            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
2127            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
2128            # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
2129            # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
2130            roots = np.zeros((10)) 
2131            weights = np.zeros((10)) 
2132            # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
2133            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
2134            
2135                
2136            #Loop over primitives
2137            for ik in range(nprimi): 
2138                alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
2139                tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
2140                for jk in range(nprimj):
2141                    alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
2142                    # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
2143                    gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
2144                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
2145                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2146                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
2147                        
2148                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2149                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
2150                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
2151                        # actually worsened the agreement.
2152                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
2153                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
2154                        # used there as well
2155                        continue
2156                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2157                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
2158                    P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
2159                    PQ = P - Q
2160                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
2161                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
2162                    
2163                    # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
2164                        
2165                    for kk in range(nprimk):
2166
2167                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2168                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2169                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2170                              
2171                            
2172                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
2173                        rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
2174                                
2175                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
2176                        # X = PQsq*rho
2177                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
2178                        # print('s')
2179                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2180                        # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
2181                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2182                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
2183                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
2184                            
2185        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
2186            #Loop over primitives
2187            for ik in range(nprimi):   
2188                for jk in range(nprimj):
2189                    
2190                    gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
2191                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
2192                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2193                    screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2194                        
2195                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
2196                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
2197                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
2198                        # actually worsened the agreement.
2199                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
2200                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
2201                        # used there as well
2202                        continue
2203                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2204                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
2205                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
2206                    PI = P - I
2207                    PJ = P - J  
2208                    PQ = P - Q
2209                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
2210                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
2211                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
2212                        
2213                    for kk in range(nprimk):
2214                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2215                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2216                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2217                              
2218                        
2219                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
2220                        
2221                        
2222                                
2223                        QK = Q - K
2224                        QL = Q #- L
2225                        
2226                                  
2227                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2228                                
2229
2230                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
2231                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2232                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2233                                    
2234                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2235                                    
2236                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2237
2238        threeC2E[itemp] = val
2239                                    
2240                                 
2241
2242    return threeC2E
2243
2244# Reference: https://github.com/numba/numba/issues/8007#issuecomment-1113187684
2245parallel_options_algo8 = {
2246    'comprehension': False,  # parallel comprehension
2247    'prange':        False,  # parallel for-loop
2248    'numpy':         False,  # parallel numpy calls
2249    'reduction':     False,  # parallel reduce calls
2250    'setitem':       False,  # parallel setitem
2251    'stencil':       False,  # parallel stencils
2252    'fusion':        False,  # enable fusion or not
2253}
2254@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False, debug=False)
2255def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, ntriplets, nao, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold):
2256    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
2257    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
2258    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
2259    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
2260    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
2261
2262    #Debug:
2263    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2264    # print(threading_layer())
2265    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2266    # print(ntriplets)
2267    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
2268    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2269
2270    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
2271
2272    pi = 3.141592653589793
2273    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
2274    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
2275
2276    L = np.zeros((3))
2277    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
2278    alphalk = 0.0
2279
2280    
2281    index = 0
2282    #Loop pver BFs
2283    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
2284        
2285        I = bfs_coords[i]
2286        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
2287        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
2288        la, ma, na = lmni
2289        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
2290        
2291        for j in prange(0, i+1): #B
2292            J = bfs_coords[j]
2293            IJ = I - J
2294            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
2295            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
2296            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
2297            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
2298            tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
2299            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
2300
2301            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2302            
2303            
2304            for k in prange(0, naux): #C
2305                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<=threshold:
2306                    continue
2307                K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
2308                Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
2309                lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
2310                lc, mc, nc = lmnk
2311                tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
2312                nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
2313                
2314                
2315                norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
2316                
2317
2318                if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
2319                    n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
2320                    m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
2321                    roots = np.zeros((norder), dtype=np.float64)
2322                    weights = np.zeros((norder), dtype=np.float64)
2323                    G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1), dtype=np.float64)
2324                    
2325                    val = 0.0
2326                    #Loop over primitives
2327                    for ik in range(nprimi):   
2328                        dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
2329                        Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
2330                        alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
2331                        tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
2332                            
2333                        for jk in range(nprimj):
2334                            alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
2335                            gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
2336                            screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
2337                            if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2338                                #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
2339                                continue
2340                            djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2341                            Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
2342                            P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
2343                            tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
2344                                
2345                            for kk in range(nprimk):
2346                                dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2347                                Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2348                                alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
2349                                tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2350                                    
2351                                    
2352                                gammaQ = alphakk 
2353                                
2354                                Q = K        
2355                                PQ = P - Q
2356                                PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
2357                                rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ) 
2358                                
2359                                val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2360                                
2361
2362                else: # Analytical (Conventional)
2363                    val = 0.0
2364                    #Loop over primitives
2365                    for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
2366                        dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
2367                        Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
2368                        alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
2369                        tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
2370                            
2371                        for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
2372                            alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
2373                            gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
2374                            screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
2375                            if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2376                                #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
2377                                continue
2378                            djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
2379                            Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
2380                            P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
2381                            PI = P - I
2382                            PJ = P - J  
2383                            fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
2384                            onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
2385                            tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
2386                                
2387                            for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
2388                                dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k][kk]
2389                                Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k][kk]
2390                                alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k][kk]
2391                                tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2392                                    
2393                                
2394                                gammaQ = alphakk 
2395                                
2396                                Q = K#(alphakk*K + alphalk*L)/gammaQ        
2397                                PQ = P - Q
2398                                        
2399                                QK = Q - K
2400                                QL = Q #- L
2401                                
2402                                        
2403                                fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2404                                        
2405
2406                                omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))#*screenfactorKL
2407                                delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2408                                PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2409                                            
2410                                sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2411                                
2412                                            
2413                                val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2414
2415                threeC2E[index] = val
2416                index += 1
2417        
2418    return threeC2E
2419
2420
2421@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2422def df_coeff_calculator_test(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2423    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2424    # density fitting. 
2425    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2426    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2427    # or
2428    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2429    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2430    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2431    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2432    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2433    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2434    for itemp in prange(nelements):
2435        # This is extremely slow even though the following is hoisted out automatically
2436        df_coeff_temp = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64) # Temp arrary to avoid race condition 
2437        i = indicesA[itemp]
2438        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2439        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2440        k = indicesC[itemp]
2441        df_coeff_temp[k] = ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This avoids the race condition
2442        df_coeff += df_coeff_temp
2443    return df_coeff
2444
2445def df_coeff_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux, ncores):
2446    ntriplets = len(indicesA)
2447    batch_size = min(ntriplets, int(1e6))
2448    nbatches = ntriplets//batch_size
2449    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem', batch_size='auto')(delayed(df_coeff_calculator_internal)(ints3c2e_1d[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], dmat_1d, indicesA[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], indicesB[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], indicesC[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], naux) for ibatch in range(nbatches+1))
2450    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2451    for ibatch in range(0,len(output)):
2452        df_coeff += output[ibatch]
2453    # Free memory
2454    output = 0
2455    del output
2456    return df_coeff
2457
2458
2459@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2460def df_coeff_calculator_internal(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2461    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2462    # density fitting. 
2463    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2464    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2465    # or
2466    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2467    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2468    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2469    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2470    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2471    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2472    for itemp in range(nelements):
2473        i = indicesA[itemp]
2474        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2475        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2476        k = indicesC[itemp]
2477        df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2478    return df_coeff
2479
2480@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2481def df_coeff_calculator_old(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2482    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2483    # density fitting. 
2484    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2485    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2486    # or
2487    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2488    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2489    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2490    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2491    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2492    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2493    for itemp in range(nelements):
2494        i = indicesA[itemp]
2495        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2496        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2497        k = indicesC[itemp]
2498        df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2499    return df_coeff
2500
2501@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2502def df_coeff_calculator_algo8(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux):
2503    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2504    # density fitting. 
2505    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2506    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2507    # or
2508    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2509    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2510    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2511    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2512    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2513    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2514    itemp = 0
2515    for i in range(0, nao):
2516        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2517        for j in range(0, i+1):
2518            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2519            for k in range(0, naux):
2520                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2521                    df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2522                    itemp += 1
2523    return df_coeff
2524
2525@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2526def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_serial(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz):
2527    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2528    # density fitting. 
2529    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2530    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2531    # or
2532    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2533    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2534    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2535    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2536    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2537    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2538    for ij in range(indicesA.shape[0]):
2539        i = indicesA[ij]
2540        j = indicesB[ij]
2541        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2542        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2543        if strict_schwarz:
2544            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2545                continue  
2546        index_k = 0
2547        for k in range(0, naux):
2548            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2549                df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2550                index_k += 1 
2551    return df_coeff
2552
2553
2554def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, ncores, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2555    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2556    # density fitting. 
2557    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2558    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2559    # or
2560    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2561    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2562    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2563    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2564    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2565    batch_size = min(indicesA.shape[0], int(500))
2566    nbatches = indicesA.shape[0]//batch_size
2567    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem', batch_size='auto')(delayed(df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel_internal)(ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ibatch*batch_size] : offsets_3c2e[min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size, indicesA.shape[0])]], dmat_1d, indicesA[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], indicesB[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], offsets_3c2e[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm) for ibatch in range(nbatches+1))
2568    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2569    for ibatch in range(0,len(output)):
2570        df_coeff += output[ibatch]
2571    # Free memory
2572    output = 0
2573    del output
2574    return df_coeff
2575
2576@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2577def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel_internal(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2578    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2579    # density fitting. 
2580    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2581    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2582    # or
2583    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2584    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2585    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2586    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2587    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2588    for ij in range(indicesA.shape[0]):
2589        i = indicesA[ij]
2590        j = indicesB[ij]
2591        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2592        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2593        if strict_schwarz:
2594            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2595                continue  
2596        index_k = 0
2597        for k in range(0, naux):
2598            # if strict_schwarz:
2599            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
2600            #     if max_val>threshold:
2601            #         if max_val<1e-8:
2602            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=1: # s aux functions
2603            #                 continue
2604            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
2605            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=2: # s, p aux functions
2606            #                 continue
2607            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
2608            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
2609            #                 continue
2610            #         df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2611            #         index_k += 1 
2612            #     else:
2613            #         continue
2614            # else:  
2615            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2616            #         df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2617            #         index_k += 1 
2618            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2619                df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2620                index_k += 1 
2621    return df_coeff
2622
2623
2624
2625# def df_coeff_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2626#     # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2627#     # density fitting.
2628#     i = indicesA
2629#     j = indicesB
2630#     k = indicesC
2631#     offset = (i*(i+1))//2
2632#     df_coeff = np.zeros((naux))
2633#     df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d * dmat_1d[j+offset]
2634#     return df_coeff
2635
2636# @guvectorize([(float64[:], float64[:], int16[:], int16[:], int16[:], int16[:], float64[:])], '(n),(m),(n)->(m)', target='parallel')
2637# def df_coeff_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux, df_coeff_out):
2638#     # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2639#     # density fitting. 
2640#     # This can also be simply calculated using:
2641#     # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2642#     # or
2643#     # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2644#     # However, we need to create a custom function to
2645#     # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2646#     # elements of ints3c2e array.
2647#     for i in range(ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]):
2648#         offset = int(indicesA[i]*(indicesA[i]+1)/2)
2649#         df_coeff_out[indicesC[i]] += ints3c2e_1d[i]*dmat_1d[indicesB[i]+offset]
2650
2651@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2652def J_tri_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri):
2653    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2654    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2655    # or
2656    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2657    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2658    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2659    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2660    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2661    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2662    for itemp in prange(nelements): 
2663        i = indicesA[itemp]
2664        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2665        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2666        k = indicesC[itemp]
2667        J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k] 
2668    return J_tri
2669
2670@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2671def J_tri_calculator_algo10(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, size_J_tri, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, naux, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2672    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2673    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2674    # or
2675    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2676    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2677    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2678    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2679    # print(indicesA)
2680    npairs = indicesA.shape[0]
2681    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2682    for itemp in prange(npairs): 
2683        i = indicesA[itemp]
2684        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2685        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2686        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2687        if strict_schwarz:
2688            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2689                continue  
2690        index_k = 0
2691        for k in range(naux):
2692            # if strict_schwarz:
2693            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
2694            #     if max_val>threshold:
2695            #         if max_val<1e-8:
2696            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=1: # s aux functions
2697            #                 continue
2698            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
2699            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=2: # s, p aux functions
2700            #                 continue
2701            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
2702            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
2703            #                 continue
2704            #         J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2705            #         index_k += 1
2706            #     else:
2707            #         continue
2708            # else:
2709            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2710            #         J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2711            #         index_k += 1
2712            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2713                J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2714                index_k += 1
2715    return J_tri
2716
2717@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2718def J_tri_calculator_algo8(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux, size_J_tri):
2719    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2720    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2721    # or
2722    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2723    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2724    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2725    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2726    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2727    itemp = 0
2728    for i in range(0, nao):
2729        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2730        for j in range(0, i+1):
2731            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2732            for k in range(0, naux):
2733                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2734                    J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k] # This should lead to a race condition but doesn't somehow
2735                    itemp += 1
2736    return J_tri
2737
2738@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2739def J_tri_calculator_from_4c2e(ints4c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, size_J_tri):
2740    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2741    # J = contract('ijkl,lk', ints4c2e, ddmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2742    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2743    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2744    # elements of ints4c2e array.
2745    nelements = ints4c2e_1d.shape[0]
2746    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2747    for itemp in prange(nelements): 
2748        i = indicesA[itemp]
2749        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2750        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2751        k = indicesC[itemp]
2752        l = indicesD[itemp]
2753        J_tri[j+offset] += ints4c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This should lead to a race condition but doesn't somehow
2754    return J_tri
2755
2756import numpy as np
2757from numba import cuda, njit
2758
2759@cuda.jit
2760def J_tri_calculator_kernel(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, J_tri):
2761    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2762    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2763    # or
2764    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2765    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2766    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2767    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2768    tid = cuda.threadIdx.x + cuda.blockDim.x * cuda.blockIdx.x
2769    stride = cuda.gridDim.x * cuda.blockDim.x
2770
2771    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2772    offset = 0
2773    for itemp in range(tid, nelements, stride):
2774        i = indicesA[itemp]
2775        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2776        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2777        k = indicesC[itemp]
2778        cuda.atomic.add(J_tri, j+offset, ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k])
2779
2780
2781def J_tri_calculator_cupy(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri):
2782    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2783    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=cp.float64)
2784    blockdim = 512
2785    # griddim = (cuda.device_array(1, dtype=cp.int32), 1)
2786
2787    # Set the grid dimensions such that there are enough blocks to cover all threads
2788    griddim = (nelements + blockdim - 1) // blockdim
2789
2790    # Launch the kernel
2791    J_tri_calculator_kernel[griddim, blockdim](ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, J_tri)
2792
2793    return J_tri
def eri_4c2e_diag(basis): 
17def eri_4c2e_diag(basis):
18    # Used for Schwarz inequality test
19
20    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
21    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
22    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
23    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
24    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
25        
26
27    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
28    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
29    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
30    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
31    #it can accomadate all the lists.
32    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
33    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
34    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
35    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
36    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
37        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
38            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
39            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
40            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
41        
42
43
44
45    # ints4c2e_diag = eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts)
46    ints4c2e_diag = rys_eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts)
47
48    return ints4c2e_diag
parallel_options = {'comprehension': False, 'prange': True, 'numpy': True, 'reduction': False, 'setitem': True, 'stencil': True, 'fusion': True}
@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def eri_4c2e_diag_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts): 
 60@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 61def eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts):
 62    # This function calculates the "diagonal" elements of the 4c2e ERI array
 63    # Used to implement Schwarz screening
 64    # http://vergil.chemistry.gatech.edu/notes/df.pdf
 65    # returns a 2D array whose elements are given as A[i,j] = (ij|ij) 
 66    nao = bfs_coords.shape[0]
 67    fourC2E_diag = np.zeros((nao, nao),dtype=np.float64) 
 68        
 69    pi = 3.141592653589793
 70    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
 71    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
 72
 73    #Loop pver BFs
 74    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
 75        I = bfs_coords[i]
 76        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
 77        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
 78        la, ma, na = lmni
 79        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
 80
 81        K = I
 82        lc, mc, nc = lmni
 83        
 84        for j in prange(0, i + 1): #B
 85            J = bfs_coords[j]
 86            IJ = I - J
 87            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
 88            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
 89            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
 90            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
 91            tempcoeff3 = (Ni*Nj)**2
 92            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
 93
 94
 95            ld, md, nd = lmnj
 96            
 97            
 98
 99            val = 0.0
100            
101            #Loop over primitives
102            for ik in range(nprimi):   
103                dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
104                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
105                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
106                tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*(dik*Nik)**2
107                
108                for jk in range(nprimj):
109                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
110                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
111                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
112                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
113                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
114                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
115                    PI = P - I
116                    PJ = P - J  
117                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
118                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
119                    tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*(djk*Njk)**2
120
121
122                    gammaQ = gammaP
123                    screenfactorKL = screenfactorAB
124                    dlk = djk
125                    Nlk = Njk     
126                    Q = P       
127                    PQ = P - Q
128                    
129                    QK = PI
130                    QL = PJ
131                    tempcoeff6 = tempcoeff5*dlk*Nlk
132                    
133                  
134                              
135                    fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
136                    
137
138                    omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))*screenfactorKL
139                    delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
140                    PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
141                        
142                    sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
143                        
144                    val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff6
145                            
146            fourC2E_diag[i,j] = val
147            fourC2E_diag[j,i] = val
148        
149    return fourC2E_diag
@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def rys_eri_4c2e_diag_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts): 
151@njit(parallel=parallel_options, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
152def rys_eri_4c2e_diag_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts):
153    # This function calculates the "diagonal" elements of the 4c2e ERI array
154    # Used to implement Schwarz screening
155    # http://vergil.chemistry.gatech.edu/notes/df.pdf
156    # returns a 2D array whose elements are given as A[i,j] = (ij|ij) 
157    nao = bfs_coords.shape[0]
158    fourC2E_diag = np.zeros((nao, nao),dtype=np.float64) 
159        
160    pi = 3.141592653589793
161    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
162    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
163
164    #Loop pver BFs
165    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
166        I = bfs_coords[i]
167        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
168        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
169        la, ma, na = lmni
170        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
171
172        K = I
173        lc, mc, nc = lmni
174        
175        for j in prange(0, i + 1): #B
176            J = bfs_coords[j]
177            IJ = I - J
178            L = J
179            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
180            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
181            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
182            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
183            tempcoeff3 = (Ni*Nj)**2
184            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
185
186
187            ld, md, nd = lmnj
188            
189            
190            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
191            roots = np.zeros((10))
192            weights = np.zeros((10))
193            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
194            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
195            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
196            val = 0.0
197            
198            #Loop over primitives
199            for ik in range(nprimi):   
200                dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
201                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
202                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
203                tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*(dik*Nik)**2
204                
205                for jk in range(nprimj):
206                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
207                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
208                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
209                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
210                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
211                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
212                    PI = P - I
213                    PJ = P - J  
214                    
215                      
216                    tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*(djk*Njk)**2
217
218
219                    gammaQ = gammaP
220                    screenfactorKL = screenfactorAB
221                    dlk = djk
222                    Nlk = Njk     
223                    Q = P       
224                    PQ = P - Q
225                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
226                    
227                    QK = PI
228                    QL = PJ
229                    tempcoeff6 = tempcoeff5*dlk*Nlk
230                    
231                  
232                              
233                    
234
235                    # (ss|ss) case
236                    if (la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)==0: 
237                        val += tempcoeff6*twopisq/(gammaP*gammaQ)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP+gammaQ))\
238                            *screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL*Fboys(0,PQsq/(1/gammaP+1/gammaQ))
239                    elif norder<=10:
240                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
241                        val += tempcoeff6*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphaik, alphajk,I,J,K,L)
242                    else:                                
243                        onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP
244                        fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
245                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
246                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))*screenfactorKL
247                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
248                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
249                            
250                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
251                            
252                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff6
253                            
254            fourC2E_diag[i,j] = val
255            fourC2E_diag[j,i] = val
256        
257    return fourC2E_diag
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold): 
259@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
260def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold):
261    # This function will return a numpy array of the same size as ints3c2e array (nao*nao*naux)
262    # The array will have a value of 1 where there is a significant contribution and 0 otherwise.
263    # Later on this array can be used to find the indices of non-zero arrays
264    indices = np.zeros((nao, nao, naux), dtype=np.uint8)
265    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
266    for i in range(nao):
267        for j in range(i+1):
268            for k in prange(naux):
269                if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[i,j])*np.sqrt(ints2c2e[k,k])>threshold:
270                    indices[i,j,k] = 1
271    return indices
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2( sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz): 
273@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
274def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz):
275    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
276    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
277    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
278    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
279    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
280    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
281    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
282    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
283    count = 0
284    for i in prange(istart, nao):
285        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
286            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
287            if j==i:
288                jstart = 0
289            if strict_schwarz:
290                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
291                    continue
292            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
293                if k==naux-1:
294                    # jstart = 0
295                    kstart = 0
296                if count<chunk_size:
297                    if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
298                        indicesA[count] = i
299                        indicesB[count] = j
300                        indicesC[count] = k
301                        count += 1
302                else:
303                    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
304                
305    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_fine( sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm): 
307@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
308def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_fine(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
309    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
310    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
311    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
312    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
313    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
314    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
315    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
316    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
317    count = 0
318    for i in prange(istart, nao):
319        # coord_i = bfs_coords[i]
320        # cutoff_i = bfs_radius_cutoff[i]
321        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
322            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
323            if j==i:
324                jstart = 0
325            # coord_j = bfs_coords[j]
326            if strict_schwarz:
327                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
328                    continue    
329            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
330                if k==naux-1:
331                    # jstart = 0
332                    kstart = 0
333                # coord_k = auxbfs_coords[k]
334                # print(coord_k - coord_i) # Gives segmentation fault
335                # print(coord_k)
336                # print(coord_i)
337                # print(np.linalg.norm(coord_k-coord_i))
338                # if np.sqrt(np.sum((coord_k - coord_i)**2))>18:# and abs(np.linalg.norm(coord_k-coord_j))<bfs_radius_cutoff[j]:
339                #     continue
340                if count<chunk_size:
341                    if strict_schwarz:
342                        max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
343                        if max_val>threshold:
344                            if max_val<1e-8:
345                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<1: # s aux functions
346                                    indicesA[count] = i
347                                    indicesB[count] = j
348                                    indicesC[count] = k
349                                    count += 1
350                            elif max_val<1e-7:
351                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<2: # s, p aux functions
352                                    indicesA[count] = i
353                                    indicesB[count] = j
354                                    indicesC[count] = k
355                                    count += 1
356                            elif max_val<1e-6:
357                                if auxbfs_lm[k]<3: # s, p, d aux functions
358                                    indicesA[count] = i
359                                    indicesB[count] = j
360                                    indicesC[count] = k
361                                    count += 1
362                            else:
363                                indicesA[count] = i
364                                indicesB[count] = j
