365                                indicesC[count] = k
366                                count += 1
367                    else:
368                        if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
369                            indicesA[count] = i
370                            indicesB[count] = j
371                            indicesC[count] = k
372                            count += 1
373                else:
374                    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
375    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_offsets_3c2e_schwarz( sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm, ntri, naux, tril_indicesA, tril_indicesB): 
377@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
378def calc_offsets_3c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm, ntri, naux, tril_indicesA, tril_indicesB):
379    # Calculate the offsets for 3c2e integral evluations
380    offsets = np.zeros((ntri+1), dtype=np.uint16)
381    offsets[0] = 0
382    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
383    for ij in prange(ntri):
384        i = tril_indicesA[ij]
385        j = tril_indicesB[ij]
386        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j] 
387        if strict_schwarz:
388            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
389                continue    
390        count = 0
391        for k in range(naux):    
392            # if strict_schwarz:
393            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
394            #     if max_val>threshold:
395            #         if max_val<1e-8:
396            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<1: # s aux functions
397            #                 count += 1
398            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
399            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<2: # s, p aux functions
400            #                 count += 1
401            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
402            #             if auxbfs_lm[k]<3: # s, p, d aux functions
403            #                 count += 1
404            #         else:
405            #             count += 1
406            # else:  
407            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
408            #         count += 1
409            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
410                count += 1
411        offsets[ij+1] = count 
412    return offsets
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz3( sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold): 
414@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
415def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz3(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold):
416    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
417    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
418    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
419    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
420    offset = np.zeros((nao), dtype=np.uint32)
421    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
422    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
423    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
424    count = 0
425    indx_offset = 0
426    for i in prange(istart, nao):
427        for j in prange(jstart, i+1):
428            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
429            if j==i:
430                jstart = 0
431            for k in prange(kstart, naux):
432                if k==naux-1:
433                    # jstart = 0
434                    kstart = 0
435                if count<chunk_size:
436                    if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
437                        indicesB[count] = j
438                        indicesC[count] = k
439                        count += 1
440                        offset[i] = count
441                else:
442                    return offset, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
443    return offset, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_count_3c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold): 
445@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
446def calc_count_3c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, nao, naux, threshold):
447    # Calculates the total no. of significant 3c2e triplets after Schwarz screening
448    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
449    count = 0
450    for i in prange(0, nao):
451        for j in prange(0, i+1):
452            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
453            for k in prange(0, naux):
454                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
455                    count += 1
456    return count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_4c2e_schwarz( sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, chunk_size, nao, istart, jstart, kstart, lstart, threshold): 
458@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
459def calc_indices_4c2e_schwarz(sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, chunk_size, nao, istart, jstart, kstart, lstart, threshold):
460    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
461    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
462    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
463    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
464    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
465    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
466    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
467    indicesD = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
468    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
469    count = 0
470    for i in prange(istart, nao):
471        for j in range(jstart, i+1):
472            if i<j:
473                triangle2ij = (j)*(j+1)/2+i
474            else:
475                triangle2ij = (i)*(i+1)/2+j
476            if j==i:
477                jstart = 0
478            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
479            for k in range(kstart, nao):
480                if k==nao:
481                    kstart = 0
482                for l in range(lstart, k+1):
483                    if k<l:
484                        triangle2kl = (l)*(l+1)/2+k
485                    else:
486                        triangle2kl = (k)*(k+1)/2+l
487                    if triangle2ij>triangle2kl:
488                        continue
489                    if l==k:
490                        lstart = 0
491                    sqrt_kl = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[k,l]
492                    if count<chunk_size:
493                        if sqrt_ij*sqrt_kl>threshold:
494                            indicesA[count] = i
495                            indicesB[count] = j
496                            indicesC[count] = k
497                            indicesD[count] = l
498                            count += 1
499                    else:
500                        return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, [i,j,k,l], count
501    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, [i,j,k], count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2_test( eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold): 
503@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
504def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2_test(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, threshold):
505    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz'. Instead of returning arrays of 1s and 0s
506    # which are then needed to be processed to get the indices of the contributing triplets.
507    # Instead, here we directly calculate the indices, however, it is not straightforwardly parallelizable,
508    # so it can be a bit slow for larger systems (>2000 bfs)
509    indicesA = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
510    indicesB = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
511    indicesC = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
512    # Loop over k first
513    count = 0
514    for k in prange(kstart, naux):
515        for i in range(istart, nao):
516            jstart = i if i == istart else 0
517            for j in range(jstart, i+1):
518                if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[i, j]) * np.sqrt(ints2c2e[k, k]) > threshold:
519                    if count < chunk_size:
520                        indicesA[count] = i
521                        indicesB[count] = j
522                        indicesC[count] = k
523                        count += 1
524                    else:
525                        return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
526            kstart = 0 # reset kstart for the next j loop
527    return indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, [i,j,k], count
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_shells( eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, threshold): 
529@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
530def calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz_shells(eri_4c2e_diag, ints2c2e, chunk_size, nao, naux, istart, jstart, kstart, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, threshold):
531    # This is a variant of the previous function 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2'. 
532    # Instead of calculating the indices which yield non zero contributions, 
533    # it calculates the shell indices.
534    # This will probably take the same amount of time as 
535    # 'calc_indices_3c2e_schwarz2' but will require much less memory, as instead of having three indices for 
536    # px,py and pz we will just have an index corresponding to p.
537    indicesA_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
538    indicesB_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
539    indicesC_shells = np.zeros((chunk_size), dtype=np.uint16)
540    # Loop over the lower-triangular ints3c2e array
541    count = 0
542    ishell_previous = 0
543    jshell_previous = 0
544    kshell_previous = 0
545    for ibf in range(istart, nao):
546        ishell = shell_indices[ibf]
547        for jbf in range(jstart, ibf+1):
548            jshell = shell_indices[jbf]
549            if jbf==ibf:
550                jstart = 0
551            for kbf in prange(kstart, naux):
552                kshell = aux_shell_indices[kbf]
553                if count>0 and (ishell==ishell_previous and jshell==jshell_previous and kshell==kshell_previous):
554                    # print(ishell, ishell_previous)
555                    continue
556                if kbf==naux-1:
557                    # jstart = 0
558                    kstart = 0
559                if count<chunk_size:
560                    if np.sqrt(eri_4c2e_diag[ibf, jbf])*np.sqrt(ints2c2e[kbf, kbf])>threshold:
561                        indicesA_shells[count] = ishell
562                        indicesB_shells[count] = jshell
563                        indicesC_shells[count] = kshell
564                        count += 1
565                else:
566                    return indicesA_shells, indicesB_shells, indicesC_shells, [ibf,jbf,kbf], count
567                ishell_previous = ishell
568                jshell_previous = jshell
569                kshell_previous = kshell
570    return indicesA_shells, indicesB_shells, indicesC_shells, [ibf,jbf,kbf], count
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC): 
572def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC):
573    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
574    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
575    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
576
577    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
578    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
579    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
580    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
581    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
582
583    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
584    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
585    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
586    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
587    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
588        
589
590    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
591    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
592    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
593    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
594    #it can accomadate all the lists.
595    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
596    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
597    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
598    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
599    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
600        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
601            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
602            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
603            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
604
605    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
606    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
607    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
608    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
609    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
610        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
611            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
612            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
613            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
614    
615
616    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
617                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
618                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao)
619    return ints3c2e
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC): 
621def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC):
622    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
623    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
624    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
625
626    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
627
628    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
629    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
630    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
631    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
632    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
633
634    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
635    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
636    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
637    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
638    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
639        
640
641    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
642    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
643    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
644    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
645    #it can accomadate all the lists.
646    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
647    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
648    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
649    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
650    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
651    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
652    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
653        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
654            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
655            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
656            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
657
658    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
659    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
660    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
661    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
662    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
663        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
664            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
665            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
666            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
667
668    
669
670    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
671    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
672    # IJsq_arr = 0
673    # print(IJsq_arr.nbytes/1e9)
674
675    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
676    # exit()
677    
678
679    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
680                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
681                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices)
682    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
683    return ints3c2e
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10( basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant): 
685def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant):
686    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
687    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
688    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
689
690    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
691
692    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
693    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
694    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
695    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
696    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
697
698    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
699    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
700    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
701    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
702    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
703        
704
705    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
706    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
707    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
708    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
709    #it can accomadate all the lists.
710    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
711    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
712    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
713    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
714    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
715    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
716    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
717        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
718            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
719            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
720            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
721
722    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
723    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
724    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
725    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
726    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
727        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
728            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
729            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
730            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
731
732    
733
734    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
735    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
736    # IJsq_arr = 0
737    # print(IJsq_arr.nbytes/1e9)
738
739    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
740    # exit()
741    
742
743    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
744                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
745                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant)
746    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
747    return ints3c2e
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse2(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, ncores): 
749def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse2(basis, auxbasis, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, ncores):
750    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
751    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
752    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
753
754    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
755
756    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
757    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
758    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
759    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
760    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
761
762    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
763    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
764    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
765    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
766    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
767        
768
769    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
770    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
771    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
772    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
773    #it can accomadate all the lists.
774    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
775    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
776    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
777    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
778    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
779        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
780            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
781            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
782            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
783
784    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
785    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
786    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
787    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
788    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
789        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
790            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
791            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
792            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
793
794    
795
796    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
797    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
798    # IJsq_arr = 0
799
800    # print('preprocessing done', flush=True)
801    # exit()
802    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
803    ints3c2e = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
804
805    # This works but not the best way to calculate
806    # chunk_size = min(ntriplets, 100000)
807    # nchunks = ntriplets // chunk_size #+ 1
808
809    if ntriplets>100000: # No parallelization upto 100000 values
810        nchunks = ncores*2
811        chunk_size = ntriplets//nchunks
812
813
814    print(nchunks)
815    print(chunk_size)
816
817    # ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
818    #             bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
819    #             aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, chunk_size, threeC2E)
820    # output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem')(delayed(rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2)(iblock, blocksize, weights[iblock*blocksize : min(iblock*blocksize+blocksize,ngrids)], coords[iblock*blocksize : min(iblock*blocksize+blocksize,ngrids)], ngrids, basis, dmat[np.ix_(list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]], list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]])], funcid, bfs_data_as_np_arrays, list_nonzero_indices[iblock][0:count_nonzero_indices[iblock]], list_ao_values[iblock], funcx=funcx, funcc=funcc, x_family_code=x_family_code, c_family_code=c_family_code, xc_family_dict=xc_family_dict) for ichunk in range(nchunks))
821    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem')(delayed(rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2)(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
822                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
823                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], indicesB[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], indicesC[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)], basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, chunk_size, ints3c2e[ichunk*chunk_size : min(ichunk*chunk_size+chunk_size,ntriplets)]) for ichunk in range(nchunks+1))
824    # print(ints3c2e)
825    return ints3c2e
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8( basis, auxbasis, ntriplets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold): 
827def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8(basis, auxbasis, ntriplets, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold):
828    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
829    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
830    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
831
832    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
833
834    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
835    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
836    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
837    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
838    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
839
840    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
841    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
842    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
843    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
844    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
845        
846
847    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
848    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
849    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
850    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
851    #it can accomadate all the lists.
852    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
853    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
854    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
855    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
856    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
857    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
858    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
859        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
860            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
861            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
862            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
863
864    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
865    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
866    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
867    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
868    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
869        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
870            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
871            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
872            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
873    
874
875    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
876                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
877                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, ntriplets, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold)
878    # rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal.parallel_diagnostics(level=1)
879    return ints3c2e
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9(basis, auxbasis, offset, indicesB, indicesC): 
881def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9(basis, auxbasis, offset, indicesB, indicesC):
882    # Wrapper for hybrid Rys+conv. 3c2e integral calculator
883    # using a list of significant contributions obtained via Schwarz screening.
884    # It returns the 3c2e integrals in triangular form.
885
886    # print('preprocessing starts', flush=True)
887
888    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
889    bfs_coords = np.array([basis.bfs_coords])
890    bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([basis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
891    bfs_lmn = np.array([basis.bfs_lmn])
892    bfs_nprim = np.array([basis.bfs_nprim])
893
894    #We convert the required properties to numpy arrays as this is what Numba likes.
895    aux_bfs_coords = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_coords])
896    aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_contr_prim_norms])
897    aux_bfs_lmn = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_lmn])
898    aux_bfs_nprim = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_nprim])
899        
900
901    #The remaining properties like bfs_coeffs are a list of lists of unequal sizes.
902    #Numba won't be able to work with these efficiently.
903    #So, we convert them to a numpy 2d array by applying a trick,
904    #that the second dimension is that of the largest list. So that
905    #it can accomadate all the lists.
906    maxnprim = max(basis.bfs_nprim)
907    bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
908    bfs_expnts = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
909    bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([basis.bfs_nao, maxnprim])
910    shell_indices = np.array([basis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
911    aux_shell_indices = np.array([auxbasis.bfs_shell_index], dtype=np.uint16)[0]
912    for i in range(basis.bfs_nao):
913        for j in range(basis.bfs_nprim[i]):
914            bfs_coeffs[i,j] = basis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
915            bfs_expnts[i,j] = basis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
916            bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = basis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
917
918    maxnprimaux = max(auxbasis.bfs_nprim)
919    aux_bfs_coeffs = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
920    aux_bfs_expnts = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
921    aux_bfs_prim_norms = np.zeros([auxbasis.bfs_nao, maxnprimaux])
922    for i in range(auxbasis.bfs_nao):
923        for j in range(auxbasis.bfs_nprim[i]):
924            aux_bfs_coeffs[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_coeffs[i][j]
925            aux_bfs_expnts[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_expnts[i][j]
926            aux_bfs_prim_norms[i,j] = auxbasis.bfs_prim_norms[i][j]
927
928    
929
930    diff = bfs_coords[0][:, np.newaxis, :] - bfs_coords[0][np.newaxis, :, :]
931    IJsq_arr = np.sum(diff**2, axis=2)
932    
933
934    ints3c2e = rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9_internal(bfs_coords[0], bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], bfs_lmn[0], \
935                bfs_nprim[0], bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords[0], aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[0], aux_bfs_lmn[0], aux_bfs_nprim[0], \
936                aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, offset, indicesB, indicesC, basis.bfs_nao, auxbasis.bfs_nao, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices)
937    return ints3c2e
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux): 
 940@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
 941def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux):
 942    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
 943    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
 944
 945    threeC2E = np.zeros((int(nao*(nao+1)/2.0),naux), dtype=np.float64) 
 946
 947    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
 948   
 949        
 950    pi = 3.141592653589793
 951    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
 952    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
 953    L = np.zeros((3))
 954    alphalk = 0.0
 955    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
 956
 957    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
 958    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
 959    
 960    #Loop over BFs
 961    for itemp in prange(ntriplets): 
 962        i = indicesA[itemp]
 963        j = indicesB[itemp]
 964        k = indicesC[itemp]
 965        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
 966        I = bfs_coords[i]
 967        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
 968        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
 969        la, ma, na = lmni
 970
 971        J = bfs_coords[j]
 972        IJ = I - J
 973        IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
 974        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
 975        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
 976        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
 977        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
 978        
 979        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
 980        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
 981        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
 982        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
 983        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
 984                
 985               
 986                  
 987        KL = K - L
 988        KLsq = np.sum(KL**2)
 989                
 990                # npriml = bfs_nprim[l]
 991
 992        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
 993        val = 0.0
 994        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
 995            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
 996            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
 997            roots = np.zeros((norder))
 998            weights = np.zeros((norder))
 999            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
1000                
1001
1002            
1003                
1004            #Loop over primitives
1005            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1006                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1007                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1008                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1009                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1010                    
1011                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1012                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1013                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1014                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1015                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1016                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1017                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1018                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1019                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1020                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1021                        # used there as well
1022                        continue
1023                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1024                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1025                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1026                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1027                        
1028                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1029                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1030                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1031                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1032                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1033                              
1034                            
1035                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1036                        screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1037                        if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1038                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1039                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1040                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1041                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1042                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1043                            # used there as well
1044                            continue
1045                        # if abs(screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL)<1.0e-10:   
1046                        #     #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
1047                        #     continue
1048                          
1049                        Q = K      
1050                        PQ = P - Q
1051                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1052                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
1053                                
1054                                
1055                                
1056                                  
1057                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1058                            
1059        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1060            #Loop over primitives
1061            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1062                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1063                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1064                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1065                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1066                    
1067                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1068                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1069                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1070                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1071                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1072                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1073                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1074                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1075                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1076                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1077                        # used there as well
1078                        continue
1079                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
1080                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
1081                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1082                    PI = P - I
1083                    PJ = P - J  
1084                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
1085                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
1086                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1087                        
1088                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1089                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1090                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1091                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1092                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1093                              
1094                        
1095                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1096                        screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1097                        if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1098                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1099                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1100                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1101                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1102                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1103                            # used there as well
1104                            continue
1105                        
1106                        Q = K     
1107                        PQ = P - Q
1108                                
1109                        QK = Q - K
1110                        QL = Q #- L
1111                        
1112                                  
1113                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1114                                
1115
1116                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))
1117                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1118                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1119                                    
1120                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1121                                    
1122                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1123
1124        threeC2E[j+offset,k] = val
1125                                    
1126                                   
1127                            
1128        
1129    return threeC2E
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices): 
1131@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
1132def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
1133    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1134    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1135    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1136    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1137    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1138
1139    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1140    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
1141
1142    #Debug:
1143    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1144    # print(threading_layer())
1145    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1146    # print(ntriplets)
1147    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1148    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1149        
1150    pi = 3.141592653589793
1151    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1152    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1153    L = np.zeros((3))
1154    alphalk = 0.0
1155    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1156
1157    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1158    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1159    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1160    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1161
1162    
1163    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1164    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1165
1166    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1167    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1168    
1169
1170    #Loop over BFs
1171    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
1172        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1173
1174        
1175
1176        i = indicesA[itemp]
1177        j = indicesB[itemp]
1178        k = indicesC[itemp]
1179        
1180        
1181
1182        # ishell = shell_indices[i]
1183        
1184        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1185        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1186        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1187        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1188        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1189        la, ma, na = lmni
1190        I = bfs_coords[i]
1191
1192        # jshell = shell_indices[j]
1193        
1194        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1195        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1196        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1197        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1198        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1199        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1200        J = bfs_coords[j]
1201
1202        
1203        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1204        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1205        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1206        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1207        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1208        
1209        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1210        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1211        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1212        alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1213        alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1214        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1215        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1216        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1217        Q = K   
1218
1219        
1220        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1221        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1222        tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1223        tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1224        # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1225        # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1226            
1227            
1228            
1229        val = 0.0
1230        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1231            
1232            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1233            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1234            # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1235            # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1236            roots = np.zeros((10)) 
1237            weights = np.zeros((10)) 
1238            # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1239            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1240            
1241                
1242            #Loop over primitives
1243            for ik in range(nprimi): 
1244                alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
1245                tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
1246                for jk in range(nprimj):
1247                    alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
1248                    # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1249                    gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1250                    gamma_inv = 1/gammaP_
1251                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1252                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1253                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
1254                        
1255                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1256                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1257                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1258                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1259                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1260                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1261                        # used there as well
1262                        continue
1263
1264                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1265                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1266                    P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
1267                    PQ = P - Q
1268                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1269                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
1270
1271                    # screenfactor_2 = tempcoeff4/Nk*screenfactorAB*gamma_inv*np.sqrt(gamma_inv)*15.5031383401
1272                    # if abs(screenfactor_2)<1.0e-9: # The threshold used here should be the same as Schwarz screening threshold
1273                    #     continue 
1274                    
1275                    # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
1276                        
1277                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1278
1279                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1280                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1281                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1282                              
1283                            
1284                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1285                        rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
1286                                
1287                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1288                        # X = PQsq*rho
1289                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1290                        # print('s')
1291                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L,P)
1292                        # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
1293                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1294                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
1295                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1296                            
1297        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1298            #Loop over primitives
1299            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1300                for jk in range(nprimj):
1301                    
1302                    gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1303                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1304                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1305                    screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1306                        
1307                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1308                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1309                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1310                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1311                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1312                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1313                        # used there as well
1314                        continue
1315                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1316                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1317                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1318                    PI = P - I
1319                    PJ = P - J  
1320                    PQ = P - Q
1321                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
1322                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
1323                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1324                        
1325                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1326                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1327                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1328                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1329                              
1330                        
1331                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
1332                        
1333                        
1334                                
1335                        QK = Q - K
1336                        QL = Q #- L
1337                        
1338                                  
1339                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1340                                
1341
1342                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
1343                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1344                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1345                                    
1346                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1347                                    
1348                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1349
1350        threeC2E[itemp] = val
1351                                    
1352                                 
1353
1354    return threeC2E
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant): 
1356@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
1357def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo10_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, offsets, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, nsignificant):
1358    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1359    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1360    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1361    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1362    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1363
1364    threeC2E = np.zeros((nsignificant), dtype=np.float64) 
1365
1366    #Debug:
1367    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1368    # print(threading_layer())
1369    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1370    # print(ntriplets)
1371    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1372    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1373        
1374    pi = 3.141592653589793
1375    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1376    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1377    L = np.zeros((3))
1378    alphalk = 0.0
1379    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1380
1381    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1382    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1383    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1384    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1385
1386    
1387    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1388    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1389
1390    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1391    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1392    
1393
1394    #Loop over BFs
1395    for itemp in prange(indicesA.shape[0]):
1396        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1397
1398        
1399
1400        i = indicesA[itemp]
1401        j = indicesB[itemp]
1402        
1403        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j] 
1404
1405        if strict_schwarz:
1406            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
1407                continue  
1408
1409        # ishell = shell_indices[i]
1410        
1411        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1412        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1413        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1414        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1415        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1416        la, ma, na = lmni
1417        I = bfs_coords[i]
1418
1419        # jshell = shell_indices[j]
1420        
1421        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1422        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1423        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1424        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1425        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1426        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1427        J = bfs_coords[j]
1428
1429        
1430        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1431        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1432        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1433        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1434        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1435        
1436        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1437        index_k = 0
1438        for k in range(naux):
1439            lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1440            lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1441            # if strict_schwarz:
1442            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
1443            #     if max_val>threshold:
1444            #         if max_val<1e-8:
1445            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=1: # s aux functions
1446            #                 continue
1447            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
1448            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=2: # s, p aux functions
1449            #                 continue
1450            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
1451            #             if (lc+mc+nc)>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
1452            #                 continue
1453            #     else:
1454            #         continue
1455                    
1456            # else:  
1457            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<threshold:
1458            #         continue
1459            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<threshold:
1460                continue
1461            Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1462            nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1463            alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1464            alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1465            
1466            
1467            K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1468            Q = K   
1469
1470            
1471            tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1472            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1473            tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1474            tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1475            # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1476            # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1477                
1478                
1479                
1480            val = 0.0
1481            if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1482                
1483                n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1484                m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1485                # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1486                # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1487                roots = np.zeros((10)) 
1488                weights = np.zeros((10)) 
1489                # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1490                G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1491                
1492                    
1493                #Loop over primitives
1494                for ik in range(nprimi): 
1495                    alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
1496                    tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
1497                    for jk in range(nprimj):
1498                        alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
1499                        # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1500                        gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
1501                        gamma_inv = 1/gammaP_
1502                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1503                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1504                        screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
1505                            
1506                        if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1507                            #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1508                            # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1509                            # actually worsened the agreement.
1510                            # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1511                            # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1512                            # used there as well
1513                            continue
1514
1515                        djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1516                        Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1517                        P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
1518                        PQ = P - Q
1519                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1520                        tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
1521
1522                        # screenfactor_2 = tempcoeff4/Nk*screenfactorAB*gamma_inv*np.sqrt(gamma_inv)*15.5031383401
1523                        # if abs(screenfactor_2)<1.0e-9: # The threshold used here should be the same as Schwarz screening threshold
1524                        #     continue 
1525                        
1526                        # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
1527                            
1528                        for kk in range(nprimk):
1529
1530                            dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1531                            Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1532                            tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1533                                
1534                                
1535                            gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1536                            rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
1537                                    
1538                            # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1539                            # X = PQsq*rho
1540                            # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1541                            # print('s')
1542                            val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L,P)
1543                            # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
1544                            # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1545                            # The following should have been faster but isnt
1546                            # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1547                            
1548            
1549            threeC2E[offsets[itemp]+index_k] = val
1550            index_k += 1
1551                                 
1552
1553    return threeC2E
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal_old( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices): 
1558@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False)
1559def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal_old(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
1560    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1561    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1562    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1563    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1564    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1565
1566    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1567    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
1568
1569    #Debug:
1570    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1571    # print(threading_layer())
1572    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1573    # print(ntriplets)
1574    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
1575    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1576        
1577    pi = 3.141592653589793
1578    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1579    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1580    L = np.zeros((3))
1581    alphalk = 0.0
1582    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1583
1584    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1585    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1586    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1587    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1588
1589    
1590    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1591    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
1592
1593    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1594    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1595
1596    # ncores = get_num_threads()
1597    # ishell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1598    # jshell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1599    # kshell_previous = np.zeros((ncores), dtype=np.uint16)
1600    # # The values don't have any significance. I just hope that the first triplet doesn't coincidentally have these values
1601    # ishell_previous[:] = 999
1602    # jshell_previous[:] = 918
1603    # kshell_previous[:] = 202
1604    
1605    ishell_previous = -1
1606    jshell_previous = -1
1607    kshell_previous = -1
1608
1609    #Loop over BFs
1610    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
1611        # id_thrd = get_thread_id()
1612
1613        
1614
1615        i = indicesA[itemp]
1616        j = indicesB[itemp]
1617        k = indicesC[itemp]
1618
1619        
1620        # i_previous = indicesA[itemp-1]
1621        # j_previous = indicesB[itemp-1]
1622        # k_previous = indicesC[itemp-1]
1623
1624        # ishell_previous = shell_indices[i_previous]
1625        # jshell_previous = shell_indices[j_previous]
1626        # kshell_previous = shell_indices[k_previous]
1627        # if itemp!=0:
1628        #     i_previous = indicesA[itemp-1]
1629        #     j_previous = indicesB[itemp-1]
1630        #     k_previous = indicesC[itemp-1]
1631
1632        #     ishell_previous = shell_indices[i_previous]
1633        #     jshell_previous = shell_indices[j_previous]
1634        #     kshell_previous = shell_indices[k_previous]
1635        # else:
1636        #     ishell_previous = -1
1637        #     jshell_previous = -1
1638        #     kshell_previous = -1
1639        
1640        
1641
1642        ishell = shell_indices[i]
1643        if ishell!=ishell_previous:
1644            Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1645            nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1646            alphaik = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1647            alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
1648        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1649        la, ma, na = lmni
1650        I = bfs_coords[i]
1651
1652        jshell = shell_indices[j]
1653        if jshell!=jshell_previous:
1654            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1655            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1656            alphajk = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1657            alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
1658        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1659        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1660        J = bfs_coords[j]
1661
1662        if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1663            IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1664            tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1665            gammaP = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1666            screenfactorAB = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1667            # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1668        
1669        kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
1670        if kshell!=kshell_previous:
1671            Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1672            nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1673            alphakk = np.zeros(aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
1674            alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
1675        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1676        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1677        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1678        Q = K   
1679                
1680        if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous or kshell!=kshell_previous:
1681            tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1682            norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1683            tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(bfs_coeffs.shape[1], dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
1684            tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
1685            # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1686            # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
1687            
1688            
1689            
1690        val = 0.0
1691        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1692            if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous or kshell!=kshell_previous:
1693                n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1694                m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1695                roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
1696                weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
1697                # roots = np.zeros((5)) 
1698                # weights = np.zeros((5)) 
1699                G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
1700            
1701                
1702            #Loop over primitives
1703            for ik in range(nprimi): 
1704                for jk in range(nprimj):
1705                    if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1706                        gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1707                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1708                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1709                        screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1710                        
1711                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1712                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1713                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1714                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1715                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1716                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1717                        # used there as well
1718                        continue
1719                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1720                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
1721                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1722                    PQ = P - Q
1723                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1724                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1725                    
1726                        
1727                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1728                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1729                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1730                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1731                              
1732                            
1733                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
1734                        rho = gammaP[ik,jk]*gammaQ/(gammaP[ik,jk]+gammaQ)
1735                                
1736                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
1737                        # X = PQsq*rho
1738                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
1739                                
1740                                  
1741                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk],alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1742                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
1743                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
1744                            
1745        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1746            #Loop over primitives
1747            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1748                for jk in range(nprimj):
1749                    if ishell!=ishell_previous or jshell!=jshell_previous:
1750                        gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
1751                        # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
1752                        # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1753                        screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
1754                        
1755                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
1756                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1757                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1758                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1759                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1760                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1761                        # used there as well
1762                        continue
1763                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1764                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1765                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
1766                    PI = P - I
1767                    PJ = P - J  
1768                    PQ = P - Q
1769                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
1770                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
1771                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
1772                        
1773                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1774                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1775                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1776                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1777                              
1778                        
1779                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
1780                        
1781                        
1782                                
1783                        QK = Q - K
1784                        QL = Q #- L
1785                        
1786                                  
1787                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
1788                                
1789
1790                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
1791                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
1792                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
1793                                    
1794                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
1795                                    
1796                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
1797
1798        threeC2E[itemp] = val
1799        # ishell_previous = ishell
1800        # jshell_previous = jshell
1801        # kshell_previous = kshell 
1802                                    
1803                                 
1804
1805    return threeC2E
@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, ntriplets, threeC2E): 
1807@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy",nogil=True)
1808def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_internal2(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, ntriplets, threeC2E):
1809    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
1810    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
1811    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
1812    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
1813    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
1814
1815    ntriplets = indicesA.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
1816    
1817
1818    #Debug:
1819    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
1820    # print(threading_layer())
1821    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1822    # print(ntriplets)
1823    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
