1824    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
1825        
1826    pi = 3.141592653589793
1827    # pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
1828    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
1829    L = np.zeros((3))
1830    alphalk = 0.0
1831    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
1832
1833    # Initialize before hand to avoid contention of memory allocator
1834    # roots = np.zeros((5)) # 5 is the maximum possible value currently in the code
1835    # weights = np.zeros((5))
1836    # G = np.zeros((21,21)) # 11 should be enough
1837
1838    
1839
1840    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
1841    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
1842
1843     
1844    
1845    #Loop over BFs
1846    for itemp in range(0,ntriplets): 
1847        i = indicesA[itemp]
1848        j = indicesB[itemp]
1849        k = indicesC[itemp]
1850        I = bfs_coords[i]
1851        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
1852        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
1853        la, ma, na = lmni
1854        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
1855
1856        J = bfs_coords[j]
1857        # IJ = I - J
1858        # IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
1859        # IJsq = np.dot(IJ,IJ)
1860        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
1861        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
1862        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
1863        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
1864        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
1865        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
1866        
1867        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
1868        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
1869        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
1870        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
1871        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
1872        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
1873                
1874               
1875                  
1876        # KL = K - L
1877        # KLsq = np.sum(K**2)
1878        # KLsq = np.dot(K,K)
1879                
1880                # npriml = bfs_nprim[l]
1881
1882        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
1883        val = 0.0
1884        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
1885            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
1886            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
1887            roots = np.zeros((norder))
1888            weights = np.zeros((norder))
1889            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1))
1890            # G[:,:] = 0.0
1891            # roots[:] = 0.0
1892            # weights[:] = 0.0 
1893
1894            
1895                
1896            #Loop over primitives
1897            for ik in range(nprimi):   
1898                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1899                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1900                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1901                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1902                    
1903                for jk in range(nprimj):
1904                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1905                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1906                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1907                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1908                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1909                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1910                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1911                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1912                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1913                        # used there as well
1914                        continue
1915                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
1916                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
1917                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1918                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1919                        
1920                    for kk in range(nprimk):
1921                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1922                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1923                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1924                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1925                              
1926                            
1927                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1928                        # screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1929                        # if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1930                        #     #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1931                        #     # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1932                        #     # actually worsened the agreement.
1933                        #     # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1934                        #     # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1935                        #     # used there as well
1936                        #     continue
1937                        # # if abs(screenfactorAB*screenfactorKL)<1.0e-10:   
1938                        # #     #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
1939                        # #     continue
1940                          
1941                        Q = K      
1942                        PQ = P - Q
1943                        PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
1944                        # PQsq = np.dot(PQ,PQ)
1945                        rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ)
1946                                
1947                                
1948                                
1949                                  
1950                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
1951                            
1952        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
1953            #Loop over primitives
1954            for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
1955                dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
1956                Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
1957                alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
1958                tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
1959                    
1960                for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
1961                    alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
1962                    gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
1963                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
1964                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
1965                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1966                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1967                        # actually worsened the agreement.
1968                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1969                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1970                        # used there as well
1971                        continue
1972                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
1973                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
1974                    P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
1975                    PI = P - I
1976                    PJ = P - J  
1977                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
1978                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
1979                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
1980                        
1981                    for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
1982                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
1983                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
1984                        alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
1985                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
1986                              
1987                        
1988                        gammaQ = alphakk #+ alphalk
1989                        # screenfactorKL = np.exp(-alphakk*alphalk/gammaQ*KLsq)
1990                        # if abs(screenfactorKL)<1.0e-8:   
1991                        #     #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
1992                        #     # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
1993                        #     # actually worsened the agreement.
1994                        #     # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
1995                        #     # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
1996                        #     # used there as well
1997                        #     continue
1998                        
1999                        Q = K     
2000                        PQ = P - Q
2001                                
2002                        QK = Q - K
2003                        QL = Q #- L
2004                        
2005                                  
2006                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2007                                
2008
2009                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))
2010                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2011                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2012                                    
2013                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2014                                    
2015                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2016
2017        threeC2E[itemp] = val
2018                                    
2019                                   
2020                            
2021    #Debug:
2022    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2023    # print(threading_layer())
2024
2025    return None
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, offset, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices): 
2027@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy",nogil=True)
2028def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo9_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, offset, indicesB, indicesC, nao, naux, IJsq_arr, shell_indices, aux_shell_indices):
2029    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
2030    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
2031    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
2032    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
2033    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
2034
2035    ntriplets = indicesB.shape[0] # No. of significant triplets
2036    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
2037
2038    #Debug:
2039    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2040    # print(threading_layer())
2041    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2042    # print(ntriplets)
2043    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
2044    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2045        
2046    pi = 3.141592653589793
2047    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
2048    L = np.zeros((3))
2049    alphalk = 0.0
2050    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
2051
2052    
2053    maxprims = bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
2054    maxprims_aux = aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]
2055
2056    # Create arrays to avoid contention of allocator 
2057    # (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/70339388/using-numba-with-np-concatenate-is-not-efficient-in-parallel/70342014#70342014)
2058
2059    ibatch_threads = np.zeros(get_num_threads(), dtype=np.uint8)
2060    i_threads = np.zeros(get_num_threads(), dtype=np.uint8)
2061
2062    #Loop over BFs
2063    for itemp in prange(ntriplets):
2064        id_thrd = get_thread_id()
2065
2066        if ibatch_threads[id_thrd]<offset.shape[0]:
2067            if itemp>=offset[ibatch_threads[id_thrd]]:
2068                ibatch_threads[id_thrd] +=1
2069                i_threads[id_thrd] += 1 
2070                
2071                # print(itemp)
2072                # print(ibatch_threads)
2073                # print(i_threads)
2074        
2075
2076        i = i_threads[id_thrd]
2077        j = indicesB[itemp]
2078        k = indicesC[itemp]
2079        
2080        
2081        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
2082        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
2083        alphaik = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2084        alphaik[:] = bfs_expnts[i,:]
2085        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
2086        la, ma, na = lmni
2087        I = bfs_coords[i]
2088
2089        Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
2090        nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
2091        alphajk = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2092        alphajk[:] = bfs_expnts[j,:]
2093        lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
2094        lb, mb, nb = lmnj
2095        J = bfs_coords[j]
2096
2097        
2098        IJsq = IJsq_arr[i,j]
2099        tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
2100        gammaP = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2101        screenfactorAB = np.zeros((maxprims, maxprims), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2102        # Ap = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2103        
2104        # kshell = aux_shell_indices[k]
2105        Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
2106        nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
2107        alphakk = np.zeros(maxprims_aux, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out
2108        alphakk[:] = aux_bfs_expnts[k,:]
2109        lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
2110        lc, mc, nc = lmnk
2111        K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
2112        Q = K   
2113
2114        
2115        tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
2116        norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
2117        tempcoeff3 = np.zeros(maxprims, dtype=np.float64) # Should be Hoisted out 
2118        tempcoeff3[:] = tempcoeff2*bfs_coeffs[i,:]*bfs_prim_norms[i,:]
2119        # PQsq = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
2120        # rho = np.zeros((bfs_coeffs.shape[1], bfs_coeffs.shape[1], aux_bfs_coeffs.shape[1]), dtype=np.float64)
2121            
2122            
2123            
2124        val = 0.0
2125        if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
2126            
2127            n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
2128            m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
2129            # roots = np.zeros((norder)) 
2130            # weights = np.zeros((norder)) 
2131            roots = np.zeros((10)) 
2132            weights = np.zeros((10)) 
2133            # G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
2134            G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1)) 
2135            
2136                
2137            #Loop over primitives
2138            for ik in range(nprimi): 
2139                alphaik_ = alphaik[ik]
2140                tempcoeff3_ = tempcoeff3[ik]
2141                for jk in range(nprimj):
2142                    alphajk_ = alphajk[jk]
2143                    # gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik_ + alphajk_
2144                    gammaP_ = alphaik_ + alphajk_
2145                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
2146                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2147                    screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik_*alphajk_/gammaP_*IJsq)
2148                        
2149                    if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2150                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
2151                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
2152                        # actually worsened the agreement.
2153                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
2154                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
2155                        # used there as well
2156                        continue
2157                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2158                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]     
2159                    P = (alphaik_*I + alphajk_*J)/gammaP_
2160                    PQ = P - Q
2161                    PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
2162                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3_*djk*Njk  
2163                    
2164                    # gammaP_ = gammaP[ik,jk]
2165                        
2166                    for kk in range(nprimk):
2167
2168                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2169                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2170                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2171                              
2172                            
2173                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk]
2174                        rho = gammaP_*gammaQ/(gammaP_ + gammaQ)
2175                                
2176                        # ABsrt = np.sqrt(gammaP[ik,jk]*alphakk[kk])
2177                        # X = PQsq*rho
2178                        # factor = 2*np.sqrt(rho/pi)
2179                        # print('s')
2180                        val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2181                        # The following should have been faster but isnt somehow
2182                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_new(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik_, alphajk_,alphakk[kk],alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2183                        # The following should have been faster but isnt
2184                        # val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_fast(roots,weights,G,norder,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik[ik], alphajk[jk], alphakk[kk], alphalk,I,J,K,L,X,gammaP[ik,jk],alphakk[kk],Ap[ik,jk],0.0,ABsrt,factor,P,Q)
2185                            
2186        else: # Analytical (Conventional)
2187            #Loop over primitives
2188            for ik in range(nprimi):   
2189                for jk in range(nprimj):
2190                    
2191                    gammaP[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik] + alphajk[jk]
2192                    # Ap[ik,jk] = alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]
2193                    # screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-Ap[ik,jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2194                    screenfactorAB[ik,jk] = np.exp(-alphaik[ik]*alphajk[jk]/gammaP[ik,jk]*IJsq)
2195                        
2196                    if abs(screenfactorAB[ik,jk])<1.0e-8:   
2197                        #Although this value of screening threshold seems very large
2198                        # it actually gives the best consistency with PySCF. Reducing it to 1e-15,
2199                        # actually worsened the agreement.
2200                        # I suspect that this is caused due to an error cancellation
2201                        # that happens with the nucmat calculation, as the same screening is 
2202                        # used there as well
2203                        continue
2204                    djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2205                    Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
2206                    P = (alphaik[ik]*I + alphajk[jk]*J)/gammaP[ik,jk]
2207                    PI = P - I
2208                    PJ = P - J  
2209                    PQ = P - Q
2210                    fac1 = twopisq/gammaP[ik,jk]*screenfactorAB[ik,jk]  
2211                    onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP[ik,jk]
2212                    tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3[ik]*djk*Njk  
2213                        
2214                    for kk in range(nprimk):
2215                        dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2216                        Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2217                        tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2218                              
2219                        
2220                        gammaQ = alphakk[kk] #+ alphalk
2221                        
2222                        
2223                                
2224                        QK = Q - K
2225                        QL = Q #- L
2226                        
2227                                  
2228                        fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2229                                
2230
2231                        omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP[ik,jk] + gammaQ))
2232                        delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2233                        PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2234                                    
2235                        sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP[ik,jk],gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2236                                    
2237                        val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2238
2239        threeC2E[itemp] = val
2240                                    
2241                                 
2242
2243    return threeC2E
parallel_options_algo8 = {'comprehension': False, 'prange': False, 'numpy': False, 'reduction': False, 'setitem': False, 'stencil': False, 'fusion': False}
@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True, boundscheck=False, debug=False)
def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8_internal( bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts, aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, ntriplets, nao, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold): 
2255@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True, boundscheck=False, debug=False)
2256def rys_3c2e_tri_schwarz_sparse_algo8_internal(bfs_coords, bfs_contr_prim_norms, bfs_lmn, bfs_nprim, bfs_coeffs, bfs_prim_norms, bfs_expnts,aux_bfs_coords, aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms, aux_bfs_lmn, aux_bfs_nprim, aux_bfs_coeffs, aux_bfs_prim_norms, aux_bfs_expnts, ntriplets, nao, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold):
2257    # Calculates 3c2e integrals based on a provided list of significant triplets determined using Schwarz inequality
2258    # It is assumed that the provided list was made with triangular int3c2e in mind
2259    # TODO: Check out these screening methods as well 
2260    # https://kops.uni-konstanz.de/server/api/core/bitstreams/79ada61a-fd29-43fd-a298-79c1696a0601/content
2261    # https://aip.scitation.org/doi/10.1063/1.4917519
2262
2263    #Debug:
2264    # print(config.THREADING_LAYER)
2265    # print(threading_layer())
2266    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2267    # print(ntriplets)
2268    # set_parallel_chunksize(ntriplets//128)
2269    # print(get_parallel_chunksize())
2270
2271    threeC2E = np.zeros((ntriplets), dtype=np.float64) 
2272
2273    pi = 3.141592653589793
2274    pisq = 9.869604401089358  #PI^2
2275    twopisq = 19.739208802178716  #2*PI^2
2276
2277    L = np.zeros((3))
2278    ld, md, nd = int(0), int(0), int(0)
2279    alphalk = 0.0
2280
2281    
2282    index = 0
2283    #Loop pver BFs
2284    for i in prange(0, nao): #A
2285        
2286        I = bfs_coords[i]
2287        Ni = bfs_contr_prim_norms[i]
2288        lmni = bfs_lmn[i]
2289        la, ma, na = lmni
2290        nprimi = bfs_nprim[i]
2291        
2292        for j in prange(0, i+1): #B
2293            J = bfs_coords[j]
2294            IJ = I - J
2295            IJsq = np.sum(IJ**2)
2296            Nj = bfs_contr_prim_norms[j]
2297            lmnj = bfs_lmn[j]
2298            lb, mb, nb = lmnj
2299            tempcoeff1 = Ni*Nj
2300            nprimj = bfs_nprim[j]
2301
2302            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2303            
2304            
2305            for k in prange(0, naux): #C
2306                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]<=threshold:
2307                    continue
2308                K = aux_bfs_coords[k]
2309                Nk = aux_bfs_contr_prim_norms[k]
2310                lmnk = aux_bfs_lmn[k]
2311                lc, mc, nc = lmnk
2312                tempcoeff2 = tempcoeff1*Nk
2313                nprimk = aux_bfs_nprim[k]
2314                
2315                
2316                norder = int((la+ma+na+lb+mb+nb+lc+mc+nc+ld+md+nd)/2 + 1 ) 
2317                
2318
2319                if norder<=10: # Use rys quadrature
2320                    n = int(max(la+lb,ma+mb,na+nb))
2321                    m = int(max(lc+ld,mc+md,nc+nd))
2322                    roots = np.zeros((norder), dtype=np.float64)
2323                    weights = np.zeros((norder), dtype=np.float64)
2324                    G = np.zeros((n+1,m+1), dtype=np.float64)
2325                    
2326                    val = 0.0
2327                    #Loop over primitives
2328                    for ik in range(nprimi):   
2329                        dik = bfs_coeffs[i,ik]
2330                        Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i,ik]
2331                        alphaik = bfs_expnts[i,ik]
2332                        tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
2333                            
2334                        for jk in range(nprimj):
2335                            alphajk = bfs_expnts[j,jk]
2336                            gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
2337                            screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
2338                            if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2339                                #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
2340                                continue
2341                            djk = bfs_coeffs[j,jk] 
2342                            Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j,jk]      
2343                            P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
2344                            tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
2345                                
2346                            for kk in range(nprimk):
2347                                dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k,kk]
2348                                Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k,kk]
2349                                alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k,kk]
2350                                tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2351                                    
2352                                    
2353                                gammaQ = alphakk 
2354                                
2355                                Q = K        
2356                                PQ = P - Q
2357                                PQsq = np.sum(PQ**2)
2358                                rho = gammaP*gammaQ/(gammaP+gammaQ) 
2359                                
2360                                val += tempcoeff5*coulomb_rys_3c2e(roots,weights,G,PQsq, rho, norder,n,m,la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,alphaik, alphajk, alphakk, alphalk,I,J,K,L)
2361                                
2362
2363                else: # Analytical (Conventional)
2364                    val = 0.0
2365                    #Loop over primitives
2366                    for ik in range(bfs_nprim[i]):   
2367                        dik = bfs_coeffs[i][ik]
2368                        Nik = bfs_prim_norms[i][ik]
2369                        alphaik = bfs_expnts[i][ik]
2370                        tempcoeff3 = tempcoeff2*dik*Nik
2371                            
2372                        for jk in range(bfs_nprim[j]):
2373                            alphajk = bfs_expnts[j][jk]
2374                            gammaP = alphaik + alphajk
2375                            screenfactorAB = np.exp(-alphaik*alphajk/gammaP*IJsq)
2376                            if abs(screenfactorAB)<1.0e-8:   
2377                                #TODO: Check for optimal value for screening
2378                                continue
2379                            djk = bfs_coeffs[j][jk] 
2380                            Njk = bfs_prim_norms[j][jk]      
2381                            P = (alphaik*I + alphajk*J)/gammaP
2382                            PI = P - I
2383                            PJ = P - J  
2384                            fac1 = twopisq/gammaP*screenfactorAB   
2385                            onefourthgammaPinv = 0.25/gammaP  
2386                            tempcoeff4 = tempcoeff3*djk*Njk  
2387                                
2388                            for kk in range(aux_bfs_nprim[k]):
2389                                dkk = aux_bfs_coeffs[k][kk]
2390                                Nkk = aux_bfs_prim_norms[k][kk]
2391                                alphakk = aux_bfs_expnts[k][kk]
2392                                tempcoeff5 = tempcoeff4*dkk*Nkk 
2393                                    
2394                                
2395                                gammaQ = alphakk 
2396                                
2397                                Q = K#(alphakk*K + alphalk*L)/gammaQ        
2398                                PQ = P - Q
2399                                        
2400                                QK = Q - K
2401                                QL = Q #- L
2402                                
2403                                        
2404                                fac2 = fac1/gammaQ
2405                                        
2406
2407                                omega = (fac2)*np.sqrt(pi/(gammaP + gammaQ))#*screenfactorKL
2408                                delta = 0.25*(1/gammaQ) + onefourthgammaPinv          
2409                                PQsqBy4delta = np.sum(PQ**2)/(4*delta)         
2410                                            
2411                                sum1 = innerLoop4c2e(la,lb,lc,ld,ma,mb,mc,md,na,nb,nc,nd,gammaP,gammaQ,PI,PJ,QK,QL,PQ,PQsqBy4delta,delta)
2412                                
2413                                            
2414                                val += omega*sum1*tempcoeff5
2415
2416                threeC2E[index] = val
2417                index += 1
2418        
2419    return threeC2E
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_test(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux): 
2422@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2423def df_coeff_calculator_test(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2424    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2425    # density fitting. 
2426    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2427    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2428    # or
2429    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2430    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2431    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2432    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2433    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2434    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2435    for itemp in prange(nelements):
2436        # This is extremely slow even though the following is hoisted out automatically
2437        df_coeff_temp = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64) # Temp arrary to avoid race condition 
2438        i = indicesA[itemp]
2439        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2440        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2441        k = indicesC[itemp]
2442        df_coeff_temp[k] = ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This avoids the race condition
2443        df_coeff += df_coeff_temp
2444    return df_coeff
def df_coeff_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux, ncores): 
2446def df_coeff_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux, ncores):
2447    ntriplets = len(indicesA)
2448    batch_size = min(ntriplets, int(1e6))
2449    nbatches = ntriplets//batch_size
2450    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem', batch_size='auto')(delayed(df_coeff_calculator_internal)(ints3c2e_1d[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], dmat_1d, indicesA[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], indicesB[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], indicesC[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,ntriplets)], naux) for ibatch in range(nbatches+1))
2451    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2452    for ibatch in range(0,len(output)):
2453        df_coeff += output[ibatch]
2454    # Free memory
2455    output = 0
2456    del output
2457    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_internal(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux): 
2460@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2461def df_coeff_calculator_internal(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2462    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2463    # density fitting. 
2464    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2465    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2466    # or
2467    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2468    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2469    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2470    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2471    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2472    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2473    for itemp in range(nelements):
2474        i = indicesA[itemp]
2475        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2476        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2477        k = indicesC[itemp]
2478        df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2479    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_old(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux): 
2481@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2482def df_coeff_calculator_old(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, naux):
2483    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2484    # density fitting. 
2485    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2486    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2487    # or
2488    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2489    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2490    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2491    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2492    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2493    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2494    for itemp in range(nelements):
2495        i = indicesA[itemp]
2496        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2497        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2498        k = indicesC[itemp]
2499        df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2500    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_algo8( ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux): 
2502@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2503def df_coeff_calculator_algo8(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux):
2504    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2505    # density fitting. 
2506    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2507    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2508    # or
2509    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2510    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2511    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2512    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2513    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2514    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2515    itemp = 0
2516    for i in range(0, nao):
2517        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2518        for j in range(0, i+1):
2519            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2520            for k in range(0, naux):
2521                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2522                    df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This leads to race condition
2523                    itemp += 1
2524    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_serial( ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz): 
2526@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2527def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_serial(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz):
2528    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2529    # density fitting. 
2530    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2531    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2532    # or
2533    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2534    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2535    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2536    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2537    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2538    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2539    for ij in range(indicesA.shape[0]):
2540        i = indicesA[ij]
2541        j = indicesB[ij]
2542        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2543        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2544        if strict_schwarz:
2545            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2546                continue  
2547        index_k = 0
2548        for k in range(0, naux):
2549            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2550                df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2551                index_k += 1 
2552    return df_coeff
def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel( ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, ncores, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm): 
2555def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, ncores, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2556    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2557    # density fitting. 
2558    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2559    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2560    # or
2561    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2562    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2563    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2564    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2565    # nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2566    batch_size = min(indicesA.shape[0], int(500))
2567    nbatches = indicesA.shape[0]//batch_size
2568    output = Parallel(n_jobs=ncores, backend='threading', require='sharedmem', batch_size='auto')(delayed(df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel_internal)(ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ibatch*batch_size] : offsets_3c2e[min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size, indicesA.shape[0])]], dmat_1d, indicesA[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], indicesB[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], offsets_3c2e[ibatch*batch_size : min(ibatch*batch_size+batch_size,indicesA.shape[0])], naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm) for ibatch in range(nbatches+1))
2569    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2570    for ibatch in range(0,len(output)):
2571        df_coeff += output[ibatch]
2572    # Free memory
2573    output = 0
2574    del output
2575    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy', nogil=True)
def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel_internal( ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm): 
2577@njit(parallel=False, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy", nogil=True)
2578def df_coeff_calculator_algo10_parallel_internal(ints3c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, naux, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2579    # This function calculates the coefficients of the auxiliary basis for
2580    # density fitting. 
2581    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2582    # df_coeff = contract('pqP,pq->P', ints3c2e, dmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2583    # or
2584    # df_coeff = contract('pP,p->P', ints3c2e, dmat_tri) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2585    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2586    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2587    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2588    df_coeff = np.zeros((naux), dtype=np.float64)
2589    for ij in range(indicesA.shape[0]):
2590        i = indicesA[ij]
2591        j = indicesB[ij]
2592        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2593        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2594        if strict_schwarz:
2595            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2596                continue  
2597        index_k = 0
2598        for k in range(0, naux):
2599            # if strict_schwarz:
2600            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
2601            #     if max_val>threshold:
2602            #         if max_val<1e-8:
2603            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=1: # s aux functions
2604            #                 continue
2605            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
2606            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=2: # s, p aux functions
2607            #                 continue
2608            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
2609            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
2610            #                 continue
2611            #         df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2612            #         index_k += 1 
2613            #     else:
2614            #         continue
2615            # else:  
2616            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2617            #         df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2618            #         index_k += 1 
2619            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2620                df_coeff[k] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[ij]-offsets_3c2e[0]+index_k]*dmat_1d[j+offset]  # This leads to race condition
2621                index_k += 1 
2622    return df_coeff
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def J_tri_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri): 
2652@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2653def J_tri_calculator(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri):
2654    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2655    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2656    # or
2657    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2658    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2659    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2660    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2661    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2662    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2663    for itemp in prange(nelements): 
2664        i = indicesA[itemp]
2665        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2666        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2667        k = indicesC[itemp]
2668        J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k] 
2669    return J_tri
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def J_tri_calculator_algo10( ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, size_J_tri, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, naux, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm): 
2671@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2672def J_tri_calculator_algo10(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, offsets_3c2e, size_J_tri, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, naux, strict_schwarz, auxbfs_lm):
2673    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2674    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2675    # or
2676    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2677    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2678    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2679    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2680    # print(indicesA)
2681    npairs = indicesA.shape[0]
2682    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2683    for itemp in prange(npairs): 
2684        i = indicesA[itemp]
2685        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2686        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2687        sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2688        if strict_schwarz:
2689            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_ij<1e-13:
2690                continue  
2691        index_k = 0
2692        for k in range(naux):
2693            # if strict_schwarz:
2694            #     max_val = sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]
2695            #     if max_val>threshold:
2696            #         if max_val<1e-8:
2697            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=1: # s aux functions
2698            #                 continue
2699            #         elif max_val<1e-7:
2700            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=2: # s, p aux functions
2701            #                 continue
2702            #         elif max_val<1e-6:
2703            #             if (auxbfs_lm[k])>=3: # s, p, d aux functions
2704            #                 continue
2705            #         J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2706            #         index_k += 1
2707            #     else:
2708            #         continue
2709            # else:
2710            #     if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2711            #         J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2712            #         index_k += 1
2713            if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2714                J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[offsets_3c2e[itemp]+index_k]*df_coeff[k] 
2715                index_k += 1
2716    return J_tri
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def J_tri_calculator_algo8( ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux, size_J_tri): 
2718@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2719def J_tri_calculator_algo8(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, sqrt_ints4c2e_diag, sqrt_diag_ints2c2e, threshold, nao, naux, size_J_tri):
2720    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2721    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2722    # or
2723    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2724    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2725    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2726    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2727    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2728    itemp = 0
2729    for i in range(0, nao):
2730        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2731        for j in range(0, i+1):
2732            sqrt_ij = sqrt_ints4c2e_diag[i,j]
2733            for k in range(0, naux):
2734                if sqrt_ij*sqrt_diag_ints2c2e[k]>threshold:
2735                    J_tri[j+offset] += ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k] # This should lead to a race condition but doesn't somehow
2736                    itemp += 1
2737    return J_tri
@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model='numpy')
def J_tri_calculator_from_4c2e( ints4c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, size_J_tri): 
2739@njit(parallel=True, cache=True, fastmath=True, error_model="numpy")
2740def J_tri_calculator_from_4c2e(ints4c2e_1d, dmat_1d, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, indicesD, size_J_tri):
2741    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2742    # J = contract('ijkl,lk', ints4c2e, ddmat) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2743    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2744    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2745    # elements of ints4c2e array.
2746    nelements = ints4c2e_1d.shape[0]
2747    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=np.float64) 
2748    for itemp in prange(nelements): 
2749        i = indicesA[itemp]
2750        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2751        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2752        k = indicesC[itemp]
2753        l = indicesD[itemp]
2754        J_tri[j+offset] += ints4c2e_1d[itemp]*dmat_1d[j+offset] # This should lead to a race condition but doesn't somehow
2755    return J_tri
@cuda.jit
def J_tri_calculator_kernel(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, J_tri): 
2760@cuda.jit
2761def J_tri_calculator_kernel(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, J_tri):
2762    # This can also be simply calculated using:
2763    # J = contract('ijk,k', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For general 3d and 2d arrays
2764    # or
2765    # J_tri = contract('pP,P', ints3c2e, df_coeff) # For triangular versions of the above arrays
2766    # However, we need to create a custom function to
2767    # do this with a sparse 1d array holding the values of significant
2768    # elements of ints3c2e array.
2769    tid = cuda.threadIdx.x + cuda.blockDim.x * cuda.blockIdx.x
2770    stride = cuda.gridDim.x * cuda.blockDim.x
2771
2772    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2773    offset = 0
2774    for itemp in range(tid, nelements, stride):
2775        i = indicesA[itemp]
2776        offset = int(i*(i+1)/2)
2777        j = indicesB[itemp] 
2778        k = indicesC[itemp]
2779        cuda.atomic.add(J_tri, j+offset, ints3c2e_1d[itemp]*df_coeff[k])
def J_tri_calculator_cupy(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri): 
2782def J_tri_calculator_cupy(ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, size_J_tri):
2783    nelements = ints3c2e_1d.shape[0]
2784    J_tri = np.zeros((size_J_tri), dtype=cp.float64)
2785    blockdim = 512
2786    # griddim = (cuda.device_array(1, dtype=cp.int32), 1)
2787
2788    # Set the grid dimensions such that there are enough blocks to cover all threads
2789    griddim = (nelements + blockdim - 1) // blockdim
2790
2791    # Launch the kernel
2792    J_tri_calculator_kernel[griddim, blockdim](ints3c2e_1d, df_coeff, indicesA, indicesB, indicesC, J_tri)
2793
2794    return J_tri
